story:
Last year I traveled to Kolkata, India with an organization called Blossomy that hosts workshops for survivors of human trafficking. I went on a whim, never having been before and new to the cause, with the hope that I would be able to help in some way, big or small. I went home feeling as though I had been changed forever, and wanted to do more. 

I was teaching photography to survivors of human trafficking. While I taught the camera basics, we also focused on self-portraiture and the lasting impact of finding self-confidence and understanding that everyone has a story to tell. Something was missing from my experience, and that was a lasting impact that would be able to ripple through more than a small group of women. 

With the help of Blossomy and Dave Junion, we want to bring a school of photography to Kolkata, India in which the individuals going through those shelter homes have access to free education in exchange for a certificate in photography as well as the opportunity for a future in a career that can provide confidence and hope. 

The school that we propose would be self-sustaining after two years. The way that it works is simple: the school is attached to a fully functioning studio in which the clients that pay for portraits sessions have their money go straight back into the school system, thus providing income for those working in the school as well as those working in the studio. 

If a student takes the 5-month course twice, they become eligible to enlist as educators in the school. At that point, they also have the option of working in the studio as a main photographer, retoucher, or manger. Therefore, those were were once students in the school can then filter back through the system to work as a teacher or photographer to help keep the school running.

We are looking for $25,000 to get the school up and running. After two years we do hope for the school to be creating enough income to pay those running it as well as keep it going for years to come, but in the meantime, we need to get things going. This money will go towards rent, educational tools like desks, cameras, laptops, and other necessities, travel expenses, educator payment, and so much more. 

I believe that if everyone donated just a single dollar, we could raise enough money to get this school off the ground...and think of how many lives could be changed, or saved, because of it. I am so incredibly passionate about this project and I thank you for taking the time to consider it. I am grateful for you.

story:
Dollars for Dreams.....

So here's my story.  I'm a free spirit hippie dippie bundle of wackadoodle with a dream! After 37 years I have finally chosen a career path and I need to get some education and certifications in order to embark on this gig.  My goal is to eventually open a holistic and natural living center offering a number of services including massage, aromatherapy, herbal remedy, rieki, yoga, meditation space along with natural products. 

 I would like to focus on not only working with the general public but those with mental health concerns, HIV/AIDS,  chronic pain and comfortable end of life transition. I have a givers soul and I feel that these are such important areas that could utilize holistic measures in addition to traditional medicine. 

I have applied to massage school to obtain my LMT at Omaha School of Massage and Healthcare (Herzing University) with classes to start on August 4, 2014.  I will also be enrolling in online aromatherapy courses to become a certified aromatherapist with the NAHA in March and planning to attend the Reiki Center of Venice in Venice, FL to ultimately obtain certification in Master Reiki practice. 

 That is where my rockstars (YOU!) come in!  Rather than asking for $10, $20, etc....here is what I'm thinking.  Do you have $1?  No?  Sweet!  Just hit the share button and forward my page to everyone you know.  Wait, you do have a buck?  Awesome because that's all I'm asking.  Just $1 and a share with your peeps.   That's all.  Can you help this old fool get to school?


So here's what I need....

School costs money.  And lots of it!  I would rather not be a slave to student loans for the rest of my life so here is a break down of the things I will be paying for out of pocket over the next two or so years. 

 Please be assured that I do not expect anyone to cover all of these things and while every dollar helps, I am gainfully employed and in the process of obtaining a second job.  That, along with scholarships and some  entrepreneurial type things that I am working on, I plan to cover a large chunk of my costs on my own. 

Associates of Science in Therapeutic Massage      $16785 is the initial tuition for the LMT diploma.  I am updating this after talking to the advisor and getting clarification on all of the costs.  This cost INCLUDES books, table, oils, etc.!  (sweeeet!) Once I complete the diploma portion of the program, I will start the associates so that cost will be coming later :)

Aromatherapy Certification                                      Approx $350 (includes introduction course with shipping and the intermediate course with shipping)

Level One Reiki Training                                          I have the opportunity to take this as an elective at OSMH so I won't need to travel to florida just yet :)


Why this is good!

I have a passion for helping people live their best lives through natural and holistic methods and I firmly believe that there is a need for people like me in the community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to help monetarily, then Namaste my friend!  Click the share button and pass it on!

  Also, if you see me hanging at a farmers market or festival with wares to sell, pick up a little something cool for yourself :)

story:
My name is Emily Cox. I am currently a student at the University of Missouri-Kansas City. This is my second to last semester at UMKC and I am majoring in both psychology and spanish. I have recently arrived in Cusco, Peru for a semester abroad to master my spanish linguistics and embrace the countless cultural aspects that come with traveling to another country. I have created this campaign in order to ask for your support in my travels to Peru and on all of the adventures I hope to have while abroad for these four months. To me, culture and worldliness is a very important component in life. It is vital that we understand other cultures and ways of living before we can fully understand ourselves. We must break the norms of every day life and see the world from another persons eyes. Without this, I feel as though we are blinding ourselves from what could be a life changing opportunity that opens your eyes to worlds we never thought possible. With your help, I will be able to do just this. I will forever be changed because of my experiences in this country and hopefully in more countries to come, I will develop a better sense of the world, while discovering more about myself each day. The help and support that you provide me will allow me to not only acclimate and learn about other cultures and different walks of earth, but will also allow me to bring back this knowledge to my friends, family and many others in hopes that they take the same leap of self discovery. 

While in Peru, I have hopes to travel to the most sacred, indigenous places such as Machupicchu, the lost city of the Incan Civilization, Puerto Maldonado, the hidden jungle of Peru. Puerto Maldonado holds one of the greatest biodiversities in the world including 2500 flower varieties, more than 1000 birds, which is 10% of the worlds species, 900 butterflies and 20 different kinds of monkeys. Arequipa also known as the white city, a center piece of peruvian commerce that earns its nickname from the many buildings made from white volcanic rock. Along with these adventures, I will also be taking 15 hours of spanish credits that will transfer to my home university (UMKC), all taught by notarized  teachers from the University of Salamanca in Spain. I will be taking a peruvian literature class, a culture for language learners class, a hispanic culture and civilizations and both intermediate and advanced grammar courses. These courses will help me to not only learn about the culture and language from an educational perspective, but from experience as well, as we will take class days to visit some of Peru's most highly sought after historical figures, such as the cathedral, the sacred valley as well as salsa classes and so much more. 

If you are willing to support and help me with my travels, I am more than willing to bring you back a special souvenir from my endeavors abroad, whether that be a handmade alpaca wool trinket, a leather coin purse, or even a post card. They have everything you could ever dream of in this beautiful country and the most magical gifts for friends and family. You will have everyone asking you where you got your special perk. I hope that with your help, I will be able to bring back life long memories and stories to share with the world. Everyone needs this opportunity in life and I hope that my story is an inspiration for you to do the same!

Thank you so much for reading my story. Please feel free to share my campaign to friends, family, coworkers, etc. Anything helps and all is appreciated!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kathleen, and I am an artist and aspiring photographer. I have always been an artist at heart, but now I need to fund my education. 

SCAD (Savannah College of Art and Design/my dream school) has given me more than $28,000 in scholarships and my family is incredibly supportive but it still isn't quite enough. Help me to fund my first quarter at SCAD.

This money will help make my dreams a reality. Artists make this world a better place, more beautiful and human, and that is exactly what I set out to do.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to provide at least $1,000 more to pay the bills for the first quarter. This include art supplies, food, housing, and transportation to Savannah, GA. 

Even if I do not get completely funded all the money will still be going towards paying for SCAD just the same. Every penny counts.

If you donate to my cause, $15-$59 gets you 2 "Save The Artist" Stickers that you can put on whatever you like. $60-$99 gets you a "Save the Artist" Reusable Shopping Bag AND 2 Stickers. $100 and above gets you a "Save the Artist" T-Shirt AND Reusable Shopping Bag AND 2 Stickers. 

I will also send out messages to those who donate you keep you updated on my SCAD education.

The Impact

Without your contribution, I won't be able to complete my education. Please help support the Art Community by supporting me.

    Risks & Challenges

    If I do not keep my grades up during school, I may loose my scholarships and have no way to stay at SCAD, also I will have to find a job in Savannah to continue to support myself. I will be independent for the first time and it will be difficult and scary but I am up for the challenge.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Even if you cannot donate, please share this with people you know.

      The indiegogo site share features are a great way to do that. Please help spread my message and help me out!

story:
ASIFA-Atlanta’s Georgia Animation Tour

Who We Are

ASIFA, The international society of animated film, was founded in 1960 in Annecy, France. With over 30 chapters, ASIFA serves as a global network for animation professionals and enthusiasts. 

ASIFA-Atlanta started meeting as a group in 1995 and remains the only chapter in the southeastern US.  We believe that animation encourages creative thinkers of all ages to experiment with digital and traditional methods of art and technology.

What We Do

ASIFA-Atlanta started by providing screenings of rare and unique animation. Over time we developed relationships with art and film organizations around Atlanta to bring animation panels, demonstrations and free workshops to students, film festivals and conferences.  All in addition to hosting our favorite annual programs:

12 n’ 12 Challenge: This contest challenges teams of four to create promos for mystery client unveiled in the first hour. Now in its third year, this client-driven animation competition takes place in 24 hours over two days. The client works through concepts and storyboards with each team before selecting a winner.  (Ages 14+)

Animation Draw Workshops: We design collaborative exercises that encourage participants to learn a variety of techniques within the same space. Whether using a simple light box for hand-drawn animation or multi-plane animation stands, we demonstrate how simple techniques can be done at home.  After the workshop, ASIFA- Atlanta compiles the sequences into one animated film. (Ages 6+)

Regional & International Screenings: As part of a global network of professional animators and enthusiasts, ASIFA-Atlanta curates unique screenings through the ASIFA’s International Animation Day (IAD) exchange program. Established in 2002, IAD celebrates the first exhibition of animated film in Paris on October 28th, 1892.  Each October, ASIFA chapters exchange their best locally produced animated short films with participating chapters effectively sharing new international animation with audiences all over world. ASIFA-Atlanta selects talent from its annual independent animation festival, “Roll Yer Own”, now in its 11th year.

 

12 n' 12, 2012. Headquartered at Georgia Tech University Research Center.
[video]

 

2011, High Museum's Teen Team, experiemental animation workshop.
[video]

 

2011, Georgia State University's Tournées Festival of Contemporary French Film.
[video]

 

Why Tour?

Since we built our workshops in 2011, we have received numerous requests to expand to after-school programs, museums, libraries and technical schools.  ASIFA-Atlanta wants to meet this demand by taking our most successful programs on tour: 12 n’ 12, Animation Draw Workshops, along with regional and international screenings.

Why Do We Need Your Help?

For ASIFA-Atlanta, this Tour means expansion. We want to learn more about what emerging animators and educators require to flourish. At least to start, we’d like to build on what we know.  That means taking established programs to new audiences and recording the process and results. To do so, we are asking for your help to launch phase one, setting up shop and fortifying resources.

To make our first phase of tour stops sucessful, we are fundraising to acquire:

1) A small office space equipped with an editing station and a traditional animation desk.

2) A website to support participants and instructors.

3) Stipends for animation instructors. 

4) Supplementary animation software and supplies.

Your contribution will directly contribute towards these goals!

 

How Else Can You Help?

Large or small, every contribution helps!

  • As part of this campaign ASIFA-Atlanta is hosting a fundraising dinner and after-pary on May 22nd! Learn more by visiting our event website: http://asifa-atlanta.tumblr.com/
  • We're always recruiting volunteer instructors, designers and technicians to assit with our workshops and share knowlege with participants. If you're interested in volunteering, please email volunteers@asifaatlanta.org
  •  In-kind contributions for supplies and equipment are greatly appreciated. If you are able to lend a hand, contact Fatimah Abdullah at fatimah@asifa.net

story:
Short Summary

 On July 21st, myself along with a group of nursing students and faculty will be traveling to Cartago, Costa Rica for about two weeks. While there, we will be volunteering in schools, clinics and care centers, immersing ourselves in the culture with classes, tours and excursions. This is truly a once in a lifetime experience and I need your help to be able to go and have the best experience possible!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, I completely understand, I just ask that you share this with your friends and families.

 

If you would like to donate to the entire group to help fund our weekend experiences, please contact me and I will get you all the details!

 Muchas gracias amigos!

story:
Short Summary

Hello world! Thank you for taking the time to consider donating to this unique and empowering opportunity for West African youth!  I am an education Peace Corps volunteer working with the Young Educator's Foundation in Ghana to host the 2014 S.T.A.R.S. Conference.  S.T.A.R.S. (students taking action reaching for success) is a youth empowerment and leadership conference which hosts nearly 70 bright, yet underserved high school students from all of the 10 regions of Ghana.  Secondary schools in Ghana often lack accessibility to mentors and role models for the students and offer very little, most of the time nothing, in the way of career coaching and leadership skill development.  For S.T.A.R.S. participants, this is often the only opportunity they have to have one on one conversations with professional career mentors, learn the importance of making healthy life choices, discover scholarship opportunities, and participate in activities which will assist them in realizing and acheiving thier potential and life goals.  By contributing to this campaign and making S.T.A.R.S. 2014 a reality, you are directly impacting the success of the future leaders of Ghana which will lead to a stronger nation!

 Data collected from attendees of previous years' S.T.A.R.S. events show that after the conference, attendees return to their towns and schools with a new-found sense of ambition and responsibility and organize activities which also empower their peers to realize the opportunities around them and take control of their future.  Therefore, the beneficiaries of this event stretch far beyond the participants alone.You see, here in Ghana, outlooks for careers for individuals who are unable to pay the high cost of university education are often limited to a very small selection of low paying jobs.  Most families cannot afford to send their children to secondary school and college often is not even an option due to the high price.  This makes higher education opportunities unattainable for the majority of the population living in the lower socioeconomic classes. Children come from uneducated parents who unfortunately are often unable to provide coaching and advice as they faced the same vicious cycle of lack of education and poverty themselves.  By donating to this conference, you are providing young people with quite possibly the only opportunity overcome their socioeconomic situation and realize an alternative future.

In order for this conference to take place, we need to reserve the conference venue and 70 student beds for one week as well as provide three full meals for each attendee and the the conference organizers.  In addition, as the students we invite to attend come from impoverished situations, we reimburse each participant for travel.  The rest of the funding is used for materials and supplies, PA system rentals, and compensation and accommodation for guests speakers, mentors, and key note speakers at the event.

If you are unable to contribute financially, please forward this campaign to friends and family who may be nterested in supporting our cause.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello world! Thank you for taking the time to consider donating to this unique and empowering opportunity for West African youth!  I am an education Peace Corps volunteer working with the Young Educator's Foundation in Ghana to host the 2014 S.T.A.R.S. Conference.  S.T.A.R.S. (students taking action reaching for success) is a youth empowerment and leadership conference which hosts nearly 70 bright, yet underserved high school students from all of the 10 regions of Ghana.  Secondary schools in Ghana often lack accessibility to mentors and role models for the students and offer very little, most of the time nothing, in the way of career coaching and leadership skill development.  For S.T.A.R.S. participants, this is often the only opportunity they have to have one on one conversations with professional career mentors, learn the importance of making healthy life choices, discover scholarship opportunities, and participate in activities which will assist them in realizing and acheiving thier potential and life goals.  By contributing to this campaign and making S.T.A.R.S. 2014 a reality, you are directly impacting the success of the future leaders of Ghana which will lead to a stronger nation! Data collected from attendees of previous years' S.T.A.R.S. events show that after the conference, attendees return to their towns and schools with a new-found sense of ambition and responsibility and organize activities which also empower their peers to realize the opportunities around them and take control of their future.  Therefore, the beneficiaries of this event stretch far beyond the participants alone.You see, here in Ghana, outlooks for careers for individuals who are unable to pay the high cost of university education are often limited to a very small selection of low paying jobs.  Most families cannot afford to send their children to secondary school and college often is not even an option due to the high price.  This makes higher education opportunities unattainable for the majority of the population living in the lower socioeconomic classes. Children come from uneducated parents who unfortunately are often unable to provide coaching and advice as they faced the same vicious cycle of lack of education and poverty themselves.  By donating to this conference, you are providing young people with quite possibly the only opportunity overcome their socioeconomic situation and realize an alternative future.In order for this conference to take place, we need to reserve the conference venue and 70 student beds for one week as well as provide three full meals for each attendee and the the conference organizers.  In addition, as the students we invite to attend come from impoverished situations, we reimburse each participant for travel.  The rest of the funding is used for materials and supplies, PA system rentals, and compensation and accommodation for guests speakers, mentors, and key note speakers at the event.
If you are unable to contribute financially, please forward this campaign to friends and family who may be nterested in supporting our cause.

story: In December, when Holy Cross Academy announced that the school would close, Home and School decided that the 7th grade would have the opportunity to attend the 8th grade trip to D.C. Since the appeal result took much longer then anticipated, there simply is not enough time to make this a reality for the 7th grade. Please help us send the 7th grade on a class trip to Columbus before their time ends at St. Joseph School. Lets make their last year have some happy memories. Thank you!

story:
Dillon's Jog-A-Thon Run

Dillon is 6 years old in the second grade at Big Bear Elementary School.   Dillon works hard and excels in his studies.   Dillon wants to help improve his school by running in the 19th Annual Jog-A-Thon at Big Bear Elementary School.  This a fundrasier to help give needed improvements to the schools infrastructures and to help fund field trips to give the students learning experiences outside of the classroom in the real world.

Past Jog-A-Thons have raised money for things such as:

  • Field Trips for the Students.
  • Sound System for Assemblies.
  • Outdoor Amphitheater for Assemblies.
  • Planting of Trees to Shade Outdoor Eating Areas.
  • Special Classroom Activity Supplies.
  • And More!!!

Your contributions will make Big Bear Elementary School a better learning environment for the students and help them to have brighter and more successful futures.

When you let your light shine, you will brighten up the live and futures of all the students at Big Bear Elementary School and the people around you.

Your Help Will Be Rewarded!

Dillon is setting a goal of $1000 dollars, but the more that he can raise the more that he can help the students and improve their school. Check out the Perks Section to see what you will receive for your pledge.

    Help the Students!

    Big Bear Elementary school is the oldest school in the Big Bear Valley.  The buildings are aging and some classrooms technology are becoming dated.  Your pledges will help spruse up and add utility to the campus, as well as enhance the learning experiance of the students through field trips and special activities.

    Bugdet Tight? Get the word out!!!

    It is understandable that not everyone can afford to donate, but that doesn't mean that you still can not help.  Shine your light by getting the word out, by sharing Dillon's campaign with your friends, family, and colleagues.  Every action counts and makes a difference!

story:
**IMPORTANT Donation Update**

Please donate using the direct credit card method through Indiegogo rather than Paypal. Do not donate through Paypal - your donation will not be accepted. We're very sorry for any inconvenience but we are having difficulty with Paypal and it looks like our issue will not be resolved anytime soon. If you are unable to donate via the direct credit card option, please contact us at kyakagunga@gmail.com for other options.

What's a Kyakagunga?! (cha-kah-goon-ga)

Kyakagunga Primary is a small school in Bujongobe Parish in southwest Uganda. The school enrolls approximately 110 students, aged 6-11. Kyakagunga is a community school, meaning it is run by community members and funded solely by students’ tuition. The Bujongobe community has been raising money for the school for many years, but they are still a long way from reaching their long-term goals. Considering that 37.7% of Ugandans live on less than $1.25 USD a day[1], raising money is a considerable challenge. That’s why we are sharing Kyakagunga’s story with you…

Our goals:

  • Complete an unfinished building: Pour the cement floor, install windows and doors, and plaster/paint the interior. Purchase a locking supply cupboard and 30 desks.
  • Construct latrines (outhouses) and provide a freshwater collection system and water tank for handwashing.
  • Provide textbooks, writing utensils, and paper for all students.

Why donate?

When you donate to this campaign, you will see how you're helping the school first-hand. We will update Indiegogo and our Facebook page with photos and news about the ongoing construction of the school. With your help and the tenacity of the Kyakagunga primary students, teachers and parents, a wonderful space for learning will continue to grow.

We greatly appreciate any donation amount and you will receive some awesome perks as a thank you for certain amounts:

$10 donation: A two weeks left Perk! Any donation of $10 will receive a lovely printed thank you card featuring student artwork and a thank you on our Facebook page. Ships within US/Canada. Additional $5 donation ships worldwide. **All donations $10 and up already made will be honoured and shipped a card. Please don't forget your address for shipping!

$25 donation: A two weeks left Perk! With a $25 donation we will mail you a beautiful, handmade, recycled paper necklace made by the local women from Bujongobe Parish. You will also receive the thank you card and a thank you on our Facebook page. Ships within US/Canada. Additional $10 donation ships worldwide.

$50 donation: A two weeks left Perk! When you donate $50, you will recieve the handmade necklace, the thank you card, and a charming, original artwork made by a KPS student. We will also thank you on our Facebook page. Ships within US/Canada. Additional $10 donation ships worldwide.

$250 donation: We will mail you an 8 x10 inch photo print of one of the beautiful chimpanzees from the Ngogo Chimpanzee Project and will include information about your chimpanzee. You will also receive the handmade necklace, original artwork, thank you card and acknowledgement on our Facebook page. Ships worldwide.

$500+ donation: You will be recognized as a Major Donor and we will engrave your name on a plaque on the new building in Uganda and receive a high resolution photo of this with our gratitude. You will also receive the chimpanzee photo, the handmade necklace, the original drawing, the thank you card and tremendous thanks on our Facebook page. Ships worldwide.

Unable to donate but still want to help?

Please use the Indiegogo “Share” features on this page or spread the word yourself on Twitter: @kyakagunga or Facebook: www.facebook.com/Kyakagunga. Also, please email this campaign to your family and friends. For any questions, please send a message through IndieGoGo or an email to: kyakagunga@gmail.com

A little about us

Fundraising for Kyakagunga is run by researchers affiliated with the Ngogo Chimpanzee Project Inc. NCP Inc. is a conservation project and scientific study of the Ngogo community of chimpanzees in Kibale National Park, Uganda. Kyakagunga Primary is just outside the national park and is home to students whose parents work with the NCP. Researchers with the NCP have been helping to raise money for the school for many years. For more information on the NCP: https://www.facebook.com/NgogoChimps

Our video was edited by Kyakagunga supporter Ethan Miller: http://www.ethanmillerproductions.com/

Check out photos of the school and join our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/Kyakagunga/


[1] Worldbank, http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SI.POV.DDAY, retrieved 01 May 2012

story:
Our son Christian was nominated for the People to People World Leadership Ambassador Program from his school. He was nominated based on his scholastic merit, outstanding citizenship, leadership skills and several other factors. This program is in Washington D.C. and of course, there is tuition.

Unfortunately, our household of 4, there is one income at present. Living check to check and at times food being scarce, tuition is out of reach for us. Our deadline to enroll him is July 17th. Our son has worked extremely hard and has overcome obstacles such as being bullied a few years ago, and not letting things such as wearing worn clothes to school keep him from being an upbeat outstanding student and citizen.

The funding we are asking for covers tuition, his airline flight, and the required clothing he needs to attend. He cannot attend this 6 day program in regular clothes as it is business casual, and most of his jeans have holes in them.

He will be meeting other leaders, going to the monuments, and learning leadership skills. This also will help him in the future when applying for college and he also obtains school credit for this as well. This is an opportunity that does not come to many and I am humbled that he was nominated and he is excited. I would hate to break his heart by not being able to send him by lack of funds.

If we don't reach our goal, the funds we do obtain will be able to hold his spot, and we will try another forum or avenue to obtain the remaining balance before he leaves in 2013.

Education and learning history and how our government started and what America was built on is important for any and all children to learn and understand to become contributing members to society when they reach adulthood, and I know that this program will encourage him even more to continue to work hard and be such a person.

Once he attends this program, the future is limitless, he has the opportunity to go to other countries and help others out and learn about being an Ambassador as well. To learn other cultures and see the world will also guide him in maturity as he grows. .

I want to thank you in advance for any contribution made. Even if you can donate gift cards to contribute to him getting the required clothes, my email is pcbradley@rocketmail.com. Every little penny helps. My son has even gone so far as to sell his Pokemon cards to other kids in the neighborhood to try to raise money, and is trying to obtain recyclables to return as well....

story:
Yes!  We have met our initial goal... but we still need your help. We are hopeful for additional donations in order to complete all of what is needed to create a garden including, storage, durable fence, ground covers, shade cover, educational supplies and more...  

Overview

Coastside Child Development Center is a private, non-profit program founded in 1978, committed to providing high-quality services to children and their families. Our services include year round, respectful care and education from infancy though age 5, classrooms designed for the needs of each age and level of development, developmental assessments, support for social-emotional development, kindergarten readiness, high quality teachers and staff, and case management services.

At Coastside Child Development Center we understand that getting ready for the future begins at birth. The first 5 years lay a foundation that influences the effectiveness of all subsequent educational efforts and is a period of incredible growth in all areas of a child’s development. We also understand the importance of the balance between cognitive and literacy skills for children with comparable attention to the emotional and social development of children. We believe that all children are entitled to an environment in which they can develop to their maximum potential and we are committed to giving families access to our services regardless of background or income. 

At Coastside Child Development Center 50% of the children we serve are considered at-risk. The services we provide for these children will not only prepare them for kindergarten but give them the social-emotional skills they need to succeed in school and beyond.

About This Project

Coastside Child Development Center is seeking $1,500 to build a fruit/vegetable, art and serenity garden for the Center. This garden will serve several purposes from teaching children about nutrition, how food gets to the table and providing positive coping skills for children while they are at school. At Coastside Child Development Center the environment is designed to enhance learning and to promote healthy emotional development. The garden is a needed additional to our Center that will provide time for the children to relax and put their hands in dirt. A much needed activity for at-risk children. 

 

Let's Move Childcare Challenge

We are completing this project in coordination with First Lady Michelle Obama’s Let’s Move Childcare Challenge. The challenge was created in order to prevent childhood obesity. The risk of obesity starts early in life. Over half of obese children become overweight by the age of 2, and approximately one in five children are overweight or obese by their 6th birthday. 

CCDC’s garden project will provide education and experience for children on healthy eating as well as an outside art area that will incorporate art and physical activity. This project will also allow us to complete the First Lady’s Let’s Move Childcare Challenge.

story:
Ankuran, which is Nepali for 'sprout', will provide a safe, fertile and healthy place for children to sprout and grow, as well as providing jobs for the community.


The Dream

To build a small home for underprivileged children or orphans, as well as to start with a special kindergarten based on the Nepali culture, combined with the suggestions given by Rudolf Steiner's Waldorf teaching. 

We are five students studying with the International Youth Initiative Program (YIP) in Sweden. For one month this spring during February and March, we will be traveling to the small village of Kahare in the Kathmandu Valley of Nepal, to work with the Kevin Rohan Memorial Eco Foundation (KRMEF).

KRMEF is a foundation founded by Krishna Gurung, which provides the under privileged, disabled and poor with an opportunity to work on an organic biodynamic farm and allows them to be productive, while enabling their children to attend school. KRMEF's newest project is to build a small home for underprivileged children or orphans, combined with the suggestions given by Rudolf Steinerâ€™s Waldorf teaching.


The Impact

The Ankuran home will help to provide orphans and underprivileged children from around Kahare with their basic needs, as well as the new kindergarten, so that their mothers can go to work. This will contribute to a better standard of living for local families, that will in return sustain the Ankuran Kindergarten.


Ankuran will focus on children of the local Chepang and Gandarva casts. The Chepang come from a background of medical and nature knowledge, while the Gandarva are traditionally musicians. While these are considered to be people of low casts, they originate from a very rich culture and tradition, however these qualities are at risk of being lost due to severe poverty. 


What We Need

Krishna has independently raised $20,000 and so we are much closer to our goal than we originally thought! However, we still need a little over $10,000.

The first step of this project is to finance the purchasing the land and initial materials required for the construction of the eco building.

KRMEF intends to build an ecologically friendly house in a typical Nepali style and has found a property next to Krishna Gurungâ€™s Foundation house in Kahare and rented it. Unfortunately the house standing on the property is too old to be renovated, however some materials will be able to be recycled. KRMEF have such commitment and dedication to this project, and believe so strongly in the fact that positive energy will help them to make this dream come true, that they have already given an advance to the owner for the land. Therefore they have until the 24th of January 2012 to raise the entire amount for the land and the first floor of the building.


You can also visit the KRMEF website here.

Or view their facebook page here.


Please help spread the word!

story:
Ingrid's Story

I am an artist and sole proprietor, who provides a variety of online multimedia services to fellow artists of multiple disciplines, non-profit organizations and other small businesses. I do graphic/web design, Internet marketing and conduct ongoing Internet research for education, strategy and development. My business is still young (founded in 2005), so I still need the communities support to keep pushing!


As a Teaching Artist in Brooklyn, I teach dance, studio art and writing to children, as well as Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and studio art to adults. I've even taught elderly citizens how to use their computers and inspired technology-phobes to love Internet technology. While daydreaming in the summer of 2009, it suddenly dawned on me that I wanted to teach. Ever since then, teaching opportunities have been crossing my path! But, as we all know, teaching is a labor of love. Thus, maintaining my multimedia clientele has become more important than ever.


However, on Monday, December 27th, my laptop and sole computer for my business died completely. R.I.P. Beep. The logic board failed and the only reasonable answer is to get a new computer. I've been running outdated software, have a ink-hungry printer that's been sitting empty for months, and have never owned a video camera.

The Impact

Your support for this cause is priceless and absolutely necessary. By supporting my purchase of new technology equipment, you will also be supporting countless individuals, including visual artists, recording artists, dancers, teachers, coaches, philanthropists and big-thinking business owners who believe in everything I stand for. Your impact will reach a local, national, and international community of awesome people -- like you!


With your help, I can get my business back up as usual and running at full speed ahead, so I can keep serving the local, national and international communities I'm already deeply involved in -- and keep growing!


What I Need & What You Get

I'll start with what you get -- my eternal love and gratefulness for starters! Depending on how much you donate, you will get a one-of-a-kind collectible piece of art by yours truly! OR choose from Ingrid's valuable services, such as graphic/web design and consultations for branding, marketing, development, or strategy for your own business. 

I'll shout out your name to my social networks, talk about you widely here in New York City, and immortalize your name on my website forever. Now, for what I need...

$3,574.90 (plus tax) for:

  • 15" MacBook Pro Laptop (and printer) with the following specifications:
    • 8GB 1066MHz DDR3 SDRAM - 2x4GB
    • 500GB Serial ATA Drive @ 7200 rpm
    • iWork preinstalled
    • Final Cut Express preinstalled
    • Microsoft Office Mac 2011 - Home and Business Edition
    • Mini DisplayPort to VGA Adapter
    • AppleCare Protection Plan for MacBook Pro (w/or w/o Display) - Auto-enroll
    • HP Photosmart Premium Fax e-All-in-One Printer (C410a)


$799.00 (plus tax) for:


  • Adobe Creative Suite Design Premium 5 (upgrade from CS 3), includes the following programs:
    • Adobe Photoshop® CS5 Extended
    • Adobe Illustrator® CS5
    • Adobe® InDesign® CS5
    • Adobe Acrobat® 9 Pro
    • Adobe Flash® Catalyst™ CS5
    • Adobe Flash Professional CS5
    • Adobe Dreamweaver® CS5
    • Adobe Fireworks® CS5


$749.00 (plus tax) for:


  • Panasonic HDC-TM700K Camcorder -1080p - 3.05 MP - 12 x optical zoom

SUBTOTAL = $5122.99


As you can see, the subtotal exceeds my goal, but I like to aim high and see how things turn out. If I don't meet my goal, I'll shave off some of the hardware/software specifications and/or won't get a video camera. Hopefully, this campaign will at least make enough to purchase a new computer and get the software I need to run my business.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! I know you love talking about me (hehe) to the people you love, so please help spread the word where ever you can! At home, at the gym, at the coffee shop, at school, at work, on email, Facebook, Twitter, MySpace, LinkedIn, YouTube -- anywhere and everywhere you can think of!
story_txt:
Ingrid's Story
I am an artist and sole proprietor, who provides a variety of online multimedia services to fellow artists of multiple disciplines, non-profit organizations and other small businesses. I do graphic/web design, Internet marketing and conduct ongoing Internet research for education, strategy and development. My business is still young (founded in 2005), so I still need the communities support to keep pushing!

As a Teaching Artist in Brooklyn, I teach dance, studio art and writing to children, as well as Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and studio art to adults. I've even taught elderly citizens how to use their computers and inspired technology-phobes to love Internet technology. While daydreaming in the summer of 2009, it suddenly dawned on me that I wanted to teach. Ever since then, teaching opportunities have been crossing my path! But, as we all know, teaching is a labor of love. Thus, maintaining my multimedia clientele has become more important than ever.

However, on Monday, December 27th, my laptop and sole computer for my business died completely. R.I.P. Beep. The logic board failed and the only reasonable answer is to get a new computer. I've been running outdated software, have a ink-hungry printer that's been sitting empty for months, and have never owned a video camera. 

The Impact
Your support for this cause is priceless and absolutely necessary. By supporting my purchase of new technology equipment, you will also be supporting countless individuals, including visual artists, recording artists, dancers, teachers, coaches, philanthropists and big-thinking business owners who believe in everything I stand for. Your impact will reach a local, national, and international community of awesome people -- like you!

With your help, I can get my business back up as usual and running at full speed ahead, so I can keep serving the local, national and international communities I'm already deeply involved in -- and keep growing!

Adobe® InDesign® CS5

Adobe Dreamweaver® CS5
Adobe Fireworks® CS5

As you can see, the subtotal exceeds my goal, but I like to aim high and see how things turn out. If I don't meet my goal, I'll shave off some of the hardware/software specifications and/or won't get a video camera. Hopefully, this campaign will at least make enough to purchase a new computer and get the software I need to run my business.

story:
Thank you so much to everyone who donated! The fundraising goal has been met. Still a week left here and all funds over the goal will go to purchasing even more books for the Tskaltubo Village School Library. 

 

Where were you when you fell in love with books? For most of us it was our school's library. Shelves filled with stories, facts, and unlimited knowledge. What if you didn't have access to these books as a child, how would your life be different now?

I arrived in The Republic of Georgia to teach English at the end of May after completing my Masters in Library and Information Science. When I arrived at my village's school I immediately asked about the library. Walking into the small room I was overwhelmed by the smell of musty old books. The library hasn't had any funding since the Soviet era leaving the students with old books in very poor condition. Almost all have water damage and are falling apart. None of the material available is in English. 

My goal for this project is to raise enough funds to build an English section at the library and also to provide students with some new Georgian language materials. It's vital that students have a chance to read not only in English but in their native tongue, developing a life long love of reading. Popular fiction and up-to-date non fiction will be purchased in both languages using donated funds.  If able to raise $500 then we will be able to purchase around 50 new books for the Tskaltubo Village School.

Working with local teachers and the school librarian we will select and purchase materials which fit the needs of all the students here. Many children in the village of Tskaltubo don't have the Internet, television, or anyway to connect with the outside world. Donors will be giving these children a chance to see what lies beyond Georgia and become active participants in the world.

While I can't offer you any perks for donating, every person who contributes will get an email from me with photos of the new books set up in the library. Every penny helps to ensure a child here in Georgia has a book to read!

story:
The Grouse Grind is Vancouver's most famous hike.

Often referred to as Mother Nature's Stairmaster. This rigorous 2.9 km (1.8 mile) hike takes me straight up the face of Grouse Mountain.

By the time I reach the plateau, I will have gained 853 metres (2,800 feet) - one and a half times the height of Toronto's CN Tower!

As part of my challenge to support Hong Nhung, I am going to do the Grind 54 times in 2013. This will be the same effort as hiking Mt. Everest!

 

Here is my story and why I am so motived and inspired to do this challenge:

Hong Nhung - is a young woman in Vietnam and for the past five years I have happily paid for her high school education.

When I was first introduced to Hong Nhung five years ago, she was working the fields and pushing around ox all day. Now after recently completing high school, her life is filled with optimism and joy.

 

Now she has a once in a lifetime opportunity to attend Nursing College.

What We Need & What You Get

Hong Nhung needs $3,500 to attend a Nursing College in Vietnam. The funds will go to her education, books, basic accommodation and food.

You will get a personal letter from Hong Nhung, photo or a special souvenir from Vietnam!

If we don't reach the entire goal, the funds we do raise will go to help pay for her first year in school and books.

 

What You will be a part of..

You can see a young woman empower herself, her family and her community. More educated women in Vietnam means an improved economy and standard of living.

What you do today will have an impact not only on Hong Nhung's life but also the people around her.

This can be your chance today to be involved with a really special person and change the direction of one woman's life!

I have paid for her high school and seen her self esteem gone through the roof! I can only imagine when she is supported by us how her life can change even more.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, you are invited to help in other ways:

Share this campaign with your friends, family and colleagues!

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Evel Knievel known through out the world as the greatest daredevil in history had a dream before he died. His dream was to one day open a museum dedicated to his life and legend. That dream never came true, Evel came close time after time but it was'nt to be. At least while Evel was still alive. Evel Knievel passed way on Nov 30th 2007 at his home in Clearwater Florida after a long yet courageous battle with Pulmonary Fibrosis.

 

Evel was my childhood hero and remains my hero today. In 1997 i got to meet Evel in person for the first time and we became friends. And being a life long fan and collector of Evel Knievel memorabilia and as his friend i want to do all i can to see Evel's dream of a museum come true. But with all worth while projects it takes money. And The Evel Knievel museum is no different.

 

But first things first. Thats where the Evel Knievel Stunt and Crash Car Project comes into play. The Stunt and Crash car is believed to have been built by legendary custom car maker George Barris. It was used at many of Evels biggest jumps as a way to promote the toy version of the car made by Ideal. The Evel Knievel Ideal toy line was one of the most popular toys in history. The stunt and crash car was also featured in the 1977 movie cult classic Viva Knievel Starring the one and only Evel Knievel.  The real life car was thought lost for many years. But a couple of years before Evel passed away the car was found in Las Vegas. Evel was planning on having it restored with hopes that it would one day be on display in the museum he had hoped to open. But as his health issues took on the larger role in Evels life all plans for the car were put on the back burner.

Recently a deal was made with the Knievel estate and the car was bought and is now waiting restoration in Florida. Thats where we are hoping for you help with the project. We are hoping to raise money for the restoration of the car so it will be ready for display at next years Evel Knievel Days. Evel Knievel Days is a yearly event that takes place the last week of July in Evel's home town of Butte Montana. 

 

ABC's Wide World of Sports was the place to be back in the glory days of Evel Knievel. Evel was one of the few people you could count on to keep his word and give you your money's worth. He was the greatest showman on earth.

Please take this time to think back to the Evel era, the greatest era in history, the 1970's. Think about the times you waited in front of your TV set for Evel Knievel to make another one of his spectacular motorcycle jumps.

Think back on that Christmas morning when all you wanted was the coolest toy ever made. The Evel Knievel stuntcycle and action figure. And you got it, memories like that are once in a lifetime and priceless. Memories brought to you by Evel Knievel.

 

So with all that being said Evel Knievel was willing to give his very life to thrill the crowd and in doing so became a legend. And now you have a chance to give back to the man that was willing to give everything. Help me make Evel's dream come true.  And all money raised will go towards restoring the car. The car will be used to promote the museum and anything else we can do to keep Evel's legend alive. Evel may be gone, but his great American spirt and the legend he created over 40 years ago MUST LIVE ON. Please help. Thanks for your time.

The Evel Knievel Preservation Society thanks you for your contribution to this worthy cause.

 Once the car is restored it will be displayed at car shows and other events. Used to promote Evel Knievel's history and the legend he recreated over 45 years ago. With the hopes of one day opening the museum Evel had dreamed of all those years.
We need to raise $15,000 for the complete restoration of the car. All money raise will be used for that purpose. Pictures of the process will be posted as time goes by. The restoration is on going if we meet our fund raising goal or not.  Everyone that donates will have there name placed on a large plaque that will be made and displayed at all appearances the car makes. Also (If we meet our goal) everyone who donates will have there named entered into a drawing with the winner getting a around trip ticket to Florida to see the unvailing of the car when its finished. Many more perks for donating as well.

 

Pictures of the car today.Plus pictures of the toy version.

story:
How do we reward those that inspire us?  That boldly pave new pathways for others to follow?  That bravely say, time and again, that is scary, that is necessary and I will do it.  How do we say good job and support them in being able to continue to do that good job for us all.  Because those of us who truly get it, know they, we are all doing it for all of us, always, true unity, true Oneness.

This is about me, Kristine, not BlueThunder.  He has no knowledge that I AM doing any of this.  Let's be clear, I freely, willingly, lovingly accepted the mission that he and I have been co-creating since 10-10-10 to do our Sacred work.  Our Sacred contract is fulfilled, the shifts will be gentled, now to the next adventure.

This dream, this vision, this reality of Light Club is asking for support to truly be born into the world through me, through Us.  

This requires me being at a place of asking for your co-creative, dig in your wallet if you can, help putting down roots again after two longs years of work in the field with no home.  Help in getting what I have learned through a life of sacrifice, modeling unconditional love and true faith for everyone, out to the World.  Now I AM choosing to finish filming Light Club, publish it and share it with all of You, all of Me, all of Us.

Reasons for Funds Required

  • The knowingness that you helped me on or before October 5th to pay my rent, keep the phone & internet on, buy groceries, you know real world stuff which is challenging when you are out serving Spirit in the woods for weeks. :).  Glad that is done, for many reasons. Days, yes, weeks, not so much. ;)

  • Funds to adveritise my new office in Elysium Medical Center in the appropriate ways to ensure a steady flow of income to meet my needs so I can relax and continue tohelp my fellow man and beast to learn to love themselves and play nice together.

  • Funds for filming, editing, producing and packaging the 12 Week Light Club DVD/Playbook package.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you really don't have even $20 to give, recently a dear friend of mine ran a successful campaign here, and I literally didn't have $5 to give, so I spread the word to my friends to help her the only way I could. Can you consider doing that for me?  for Light Club?  heck, for Light.
  • In addtion, please see me, feel me, know me as only successful in this endeavor, pray, visualize, focus, imagine, any of these words, work with me and assist me in being successful and making this happen.
  • Please consider using the share tools here at Indiegogo.

Thank you for all your help and love. I AM in infinite love and gratitude and so it is. :) xoxoxoxoxoxox

story:
Challenge #1

Fresh water is emerging as the most critical resource issue facing humanity.  The U.S. has risen to the top of chart for water usage totaling 410 billion gallons per day.  In California 19% of statewide energy is expended for the purpose of transporting and cleaning water.  Of the clean water that flows into Californian homes, over 50% is used outdoors.  This is simply unsustainable.   

 

Challenge #2

In the 20th century, education put youth in rows of desks and asked them to learn through canned lectures. We can no longer afford to train workers for the 20th century job market. The 21st century job market demands the ability to apply new technology across multiple disciplines, communicate via new media, and apply  classroom lessons in the field.  We need a 21st Century Workforce.  

 

Response

We have developed the Environmental Media Workshop to address both of these challenges.  Students hone 21st Century Workforce skills by tackling real world problems. They have discovered that  WATER is the issue of their generation, and that  rainwater harvesting is a simple, effective solutions to address this problem.  Their work  is aimed at building awareness about Rainwater Harvesting Systems. In the process of creating a Rainwater Harvesting Campaign, these students will learn the basic techniques media campaign development .  

At the core of this campaign will be a short film that promotes residential rainwater harvesting systems as a means to tackle this global issue by acting at the local level. We have already garnered strong local support for our efforts. Our partners include the Contra Costa County Workforce Development Board, the City of Martinez, the Watershed Project, the Contra Costa County Water Conservation & Flood Control District, The Friends of Alhambra Creek and Kiwanis International – Martinez.

 

Who Are We

LUNCHBOX INTERNATIONAL is a digital development company creating culturally relevant films and content for the global market. With our background in music video, branded entertainment and feature films we are pop culture aficionados who pride ourselves on creating and executing superior product. We believe that everyone has a story to tell.

The mission of Lunchbox Edutainment is to maximize community impact by partnering with educators and non-profit organizations to bring the power of storytelling to college and high school students. Our goal is to give voice to the voiceless - then project it on the world stage.

The driving force behind Lunchbox International is Professor Steven A. Cleveland from the Department of Ethnic Studies at CSUEB who brings years of experience as an executive, creative producer, project manager and youth educator to every workshop.  

We have joined forces with the New Leaf: A Sustainable Living Collaborative on a rainwater harvesting project. New Leaf is a high school program which employes out of the box, project-based learning to helps students reach their full potential. Dr. Rona Zollinger, Co-Founder of New Leaf and 2012-2013 County Teacher of the Year, encourages her students to unearth issues of sustainability and create authentic relationships with their local environment and community. In our workshop, the students grow within a collaborative atmosphere. Our  team is helping to transform education and the local environment by moving their community towards a sustainable future.  


What Is Needed

We need to raise the funds to provide 20 students with hands-on, project-based service-learning, that looks to communicate the importance of conserving water while preparing students for the 21st century job market.

The funding will go directly to:

  • Student professional training in

    • Marketing

    • Green Design and Rainwater Harvesting Systems

    • Project Management

  • Life Skills Workshops

  • Producing Rainwater Harvesting

    • Film

    • Website

    • Promotional Flyers

Over the summer, the students will develop a campaign targeting homeowners, with the goal of installing over 5,000 gallons of rainwater harvesting capacity in Martinez, CA. The students will be trained as project managers, which will require that they learn both green and new media job skills. Students will learn directly from rainwater harvesting and green building professionals who will train them in the fundamentals of sustainable design.

 

Please contribute!  Share this link with friends !  Like us on Facebook at Lunchbox International!  Follow us on Twitter @lunchboxintl!
story_txt:
Challenge #1
Fresh water is emerging as the most critical resource issue facing humanity.  The U.S. has risen to the top of chart for water usage totaling 410 billion gallons per day.  In California 19% of statewide energy is expended for the purpose of transporting and cleaning water.  Of the clean water that flows into Californian homes, over 50% is used outdoors.  This is simply unsustainable.   
 
Challenge #2
In the 20th century, education put youth in rows of desks and asked them to learn through canned lectures. We can no longer afford to train workers for the 20th century job market. The 21st century job market demands the ability to apply new technology across multiple disciplines, communicate via new media, and apply  classroom lessons in the field.  We need a 21st Century Workforce.  
 
Response
We have developed the Environmental Media Workshop to address both of these challenges.  Students hone 21st Century Workforce skills by tackling real world problems. They have discovered that  WATER is the issue of their generation, and that  rainwater harvesting is a simple, effective solutions to address this problem.  Their work  is aimed at building awareness about Rainwater Harvesting Systems. In the process of creating a Rainwater Harvesting Campaign, these students will learn the basic techniques media campaign development .  
At the core of this campaign will be a short film that promotes residential rainwater harvesting systems as a means to tackle this global issue by acting at the local level. We have already garnered strong local support for our efforts. Our partners include the Contra Costa County Workforce Development Board, the City of Martinez, the Watershed Project, the Contra Costa County Water Conservation & Flood Control District, The Friends of Alhambra Creek and Kiwanis International – Martinez.
 
Who Are We
LUNCHBOX INTERNATIONAL is a digital development company creating culturally relevant films and content for the global market. With our background in music video, branded entertainment and feature films we are pop culture aficionados who pride ourselves on creating and executing superior product. We believe that everyone has a story to tell.
The mission of Lunchbox Edutainment is to maximize community impact by partnering with educators and non-profit organizations to bring the power of storytelling to college and high school students. Our goal is to give voice to the voiceless - then project it on the world stage.
The driving force behind Lunchbox International is Professor Steven A. Cleveland from the Department of Ethnic Studies at CSUEB who brings years of experience as an executive, creative producer, project manager and youth educator to every workshop.  
We have joined forces with the New Leaf: A Sustainable Living Collaborative on a rainwater harvesting project. New Leaf is a high school program which employes out of the box, project-based learning to helps students reach their full potential. Dr. Rona Zollinger, Co-Founder of New Leaf and 2012-2013 County Teacher of the Year, encourages her students to unearth issues of sustainability and create authentic relationships with their local environment and community. In our workshop, the students grow within a collaborative atmosphere. Our  team is helping to transform education and the local environment by moving their community towards a sustainable future.  
What Is Needed
We need to raise the funds to provide 20 students with hands-on, project-based service-learning, that looks to communicate the importance of conserving water while preparing students for the 21st century job market.
The funding will go directly to:


Student professional training in 



Marketing


Green Design and Rainwater Harvesting Systems 


Project Management



Life Skills Workshops


Producing Rainwater Harvesting 



Film


Website 


Promotional Flyers


Over the summer, the students will develop a campaign targeting homeowners, with the goal of installing over 5,000 gallons of rainwater harvesting capacity in Martinez, CA. The students will be trained as project managers, which will require that they learn both green and new media job skills. Students will learn directly from rainwater harvesting and green building professionals who will train them in the fundamentals of sustainable design.
 
Please contribute!  Share this link with friends !  Like us on Facebook at Lunchbox International!  Follow us on Twitter @lunchboxintl!

story:
Striving for Global Peace and Prosperity through Education

Yes, you heard us right, global peace. Education has always been the key to successful livelihoods, stable economies, tolerant and diverse civil societies. With the unprecedented, and nearly untapped capacity of the Internet to connect us in learning, we have all the tools and capabilities we need. If it's leadership you're looking for, we've put our hands up. You can be a leader as well.

We're willing (and able) to help develop online education designs, conduct reearch, and provide tools for learner success. Are you willing to build? If yes, we welcome you aboard!

Together we can make amazing things happen in global education. Every single course that is built, and offered, and participated in can change the landscape of human learning. You can be part of that.

Here are our vision, mission and values for you to consider...

Vision: Online learning is inclusive, engaging and effective.

Mission: Deliver well-designed and effective, online courses and open education resources to diverse learners around the world.

Values:

  • Knowledge is a public good
  • Open education is not low quality education
  • Teachers and learners are equal partners
  • Through education we are empowered to achieve our goals
  • Through education we are empowered to help others

What We Need & What You Get

Right now we need funding and evidence that we're on the right track. Crowd funding is the perfect place for those elements to converge. Our ideas and values need to spread and we need to demonstrate to foundations and granting organizations that we have the public trust for our work.

We need partners that believe that education is a right. Partners that believe they can make a difference by funding and participating in learning, teaching and supporting the learning of others. You can be a partner by offering any donation level.

What you get in return are courses. As many as we can build in the coming year with partner institutions and individuals. The first three will be:

Online Instruction for Open Educators

DIY-PLE: Build Your Own Learning Space

Open Course Design Using Open Tools

All courses will be no-cost for the learners and open to anyone interested in participating.

With your support, we will construct a well-designed, easy to use learning, teaching, and gathering place where we can conduct research, explore and promote lifelong learning.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this message with your communities and stay tuned for campaign news. Talk about this idea with others and invite them to join with us in this venture. Once the course platform and open resource library are built, there will be many needs for content, media and technology specialists, instructional designers, and writers.

What do you know that you would love to teach? What can you teach that can help someone improve their livelihood opportunities? Think about it and join with us when you can. If you've never taught or learned online, our team will provide guidance and support to help you have a positive and useful learning experience, or build a good course.

story:
Summary

ABOUT US: Young and Active Nigeria is a vibrant group of young change makers whose passion is to challenge the future, influence it and push for youth-driven innovation that will engender change in Nigeria. 

Young people are naturally inventive, creative, and enterprising and it’s our goal and objective to build on this sense of adventure and provide a variety of empowerment opportunities for supporting young Nigerians. 

The One Child, One Dictionary Campaign is part of our education drive towards a generation of Nigerian children that can communicate fluently and eloquently thus improving academic performance. 


ABOUT THE ONE CHILD, ONE DICTIONARY CAMPAIGN: A research carried out shows that many children in public schools in Nigeria do not have dictionaries. Not because they do not want, but simply because their parents cannot afford it. The 2014 book drive is geared towards ENHANCING READING, WRITING AND SPELLING IN NIGERIA’S YOUNG.  Encouraging Nigeria’s Young to enhance their vocabulary, diction and quality learning. The future of the children  in Nigeria will be better for it if we can arm them now with dictionaries that will in turn aid their learning. This year’s project is targeted at equipping selected rural schools in the six geo-political zones of Nigeria. 

We urge you to put a smile on the face of At least one child by donating towards the 2014 Book Drive. The sole purpose is to empower the Nigerian child. 


What We Need 

Donation towards buying 9800 Pocket English Dictionaries at the cost of£5.00 each (including shipping cost). We aim to donate 265 Dictionaries per State in Nigeria.

The Impact

Supporting this campaign means a lot to us. Through your donation, together we will be supporting thousands of Nigerian children in a bid to get better at comprehension, wider vocabulary, better syntax and greater confidence.

Basically, your donation will go a long way in improving the future academic performance of thousands of Nigerian children.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kurt Bognar and I am the Computer Coordinator for the after-school program at Cureton Elementary school. Our school, which is on the East Side of San Jose, is a part of the Alum Rock School District. We want to bring our school into the 21st century, however we don't have the technical skills to optimize the technology available to us. These funds will allow us to teach our students the skills to compete with their more affluent counterparts around the country. Since we are in the Silicon Valley, you would expect a school near companies like Google and Cisco to use innovative technology to enhance the learning experience and to have top tier technology initiatives so they can get jobs at tech companies in the area. To give our students the best opportunity to advance themselves by preparing them for real world experiences early on. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $2500 to help our school with some much needed Ed-Tech initiatives. We have a decent amount of physical devices in the classroom, but we don't have the skillset to optimize its use. 
  • The money goes into the PTA's account because they have less restriction about what they can use the money on which makes it easier to earmark it for seminars for teachers, buying programs, or possibly a new teacher. 
  • I hope you like the shirts and scarves you get for your donation. I hope you will wear our Cougar gear proudly!

The Impact

  • Coming from a Title I school in California, we wanted to create a project that would allow our students to compete with their more affluent counter parts across town. 
  • Educators find the use of technological devices in education, a great way to engage students because it attracts them with a fun learning environment. 
  • As we know,different students have different learning styles, technology helps them learn in the way they’re comfortable with. Many games, story telling apps, online tools, etc., are introduced into the elementary classroom to engage students more effectively than with traditional approaches. 
  • Tablets, Desktop computers, iPads, etc., help educators and parents to provide students with the personalized learning environment and also helps them learn interactively through many games and apps. It has become easy for teachers to engage students with lesson concepts through animations, presentations, etc., rather than depending on textbooks and blackboard.
  • Use of internet in education benefits students as well as educators and makes them work on what really matters. Many online tools that connect teachers, students and parents have been introduced into the classroom to help them collaborate from anywhere and at any time. For example, Schoolfy, an educational social networking platform that enables teachers to add their students, parents and other colleagues, saves their time by providing them with many tools which include setting homework, sending documents, creating calendars and students’ assessments. Technology develops students’ social skills, research skills and communication skills. The only task of parents and educators is to make children aware of digital citizenship. 21st century technology also helps educators and parents to make children the perfect digital citizens.

Risks & Challenges

Our team is comprised of a 8 people working for a non-profit that has been a partner at the school for 5 years. We hope this shows that we are credible and will stop at nothing to help these students.

Other Ways You Can Help

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign using the IndieGoGo share tools for your social media of choice.

FAQ

I'm having trouble with Paypal or am not sure that my payment went through. What can I do to complete my contribution?

Sorry to hear about the difficulty!  If you're having any trouble at all contributing via Paypal, or if you want to confirm that your payment went through, please contact us at kurtbognarii@gmail.com  We'll do everything we can to smooth it out and make it as simple as possible for you!

How do I pick my shirt size?

Don't fret! Here is how Indiegogo works: we receive your contact information when you contribute, and after the campaign, we'll reach out to have you confirm the size you'd like.    

What's the timeline for receiving the perks?

We've estimated that we will ship the shirts and scarves your way in 1 month or less. Thank you for your support and patience during the process of building this campaign!

story:
So what is this all about?
-Richmond Cycling Corps does revolutionary, innovative, and extremely effective outreach toward youth living in public housing here in Richmond, VA. In the spring of 2014, RCC launched the Armstrong High School Cycling Team, a youth mountain bike racing team and after school program. The team is available at no cost to its participants and focuses heavily on accountability, hard work, and strong guidance.

-We are blasting off of the incredibly successful first year of the Armstrong Team (Armstrong is among the most under-served high schools in Virginia, yet ranked 3rd out of 14 other schools competing in the NICA inter-school race series). We are expanding the program into one middle school and two elementary schools within the same district. We will be working with close to 100 young people for the 2015 year, providing strong programs and role models, as well as once in a lifetime trips to races and mountain bike destinations throughout the region.

-We need your help to hire more staff! In order to effectively quadruple our programming and bring this good thing to as many youth as possible, we need to hire a third coach! We have the IDEAL candidate: Matt Kuhn

Who is this Matt Kuhn fellow?
-Matt has been with us since Jump...er...Phaup Street! (Phaup St. is one of the main arteries through Fairfield Court, the public housing project we are predominantly focused within). He has been a stalwart volunteer since 2011, and already has a very strong bond with all of our youth. He's not too shabby on the bike either as you will see in the video above!

-Matt is also an Eagle scout and Wilderness First Responder. He has a degree in Sociology from Virginia Commonwealth University and has been riding bicycles in a serious way for over a decade.

REAL TALK:
-Let me be frank for a moment. The shiny material trappings of an organization's programming are fun and easy to fund. They are tangible, satisfying to look at, easy to put one's finger on. Within RCC, we certainly have nothing less that humble gratitude for every bike in our stable.

But this is a special case. If not placed in the capable hands of a dedicated and special person, the bicycle is merely a shiny toy. The magic occurs when the right tool is put in the hands of the right person. Matt Kuhn is absolutely that person. Allowing him to join our organization as full time staff will effectively provide a whole slew of youth with a role model dedicated to their wellfare and development. We are asking for your help funding this important person's salary for the 2015 calender year.

If you think about it, what could possibly be better than to give a young person a strong mentor? Your contribution will fund Matt's salary for one whole year of full-time outreach work! So please, help us get Matt Kuhn for Valentine's Day this year!

Impact?
-Massive as far as we are concerned. Providing us with the funds to make this new hire will allow for huge growth in our programming and the reach of our influence. Most important is the simple fact that such a large number of youth will get a role model who can do a world of good for them.

Other ways to help:
-Thank you so much for reading this far. If you are unable to give at this time, simply sharing this with others will be a huge help and a contribution in and of itself.
-Like us on Facebook! (See link below). We post regularly with program pictures and updates and would love to have you along for the ride.

Your donation is available as a tax deduction under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. Federal ID #: 58-2508155

Special thanks:
-A big thank you to Kate Hoof at Parts and Labour Productions (http://vimeo.com/user7073728) for generously donating her time and talent to create the video content for this page. We couldn't do it without your help- you rock Kate!
