story:
The 18 acre Jaycee Fields and Sports Park in Wilmington, the heart of South Bay Los Angeles is currently in disrepair. It needs to be saved for future generations. 

After 3 years of waiting. The Wilmington Jaycees Foundation has formed a new non-profit (The USAIOS) and signed a 30 year lease to save the park. A Former New York Giant and his team of locals from the area plan to turn things around. Below: a message from the President, McCann Utu.



Visit our Site: http://usaios.com/
Visit our Facebook: http://on.fb.me/18NMVf2

The 18 acre Jaycee Fields Sports Park located at 1700 Figueroa Street in Wilmington, CA. It has an excellent location and facilities for outdoor sports. The property was originally leased to the Wilmington Jaycee Foundation 39 years ago in 3 year increments. Since it's original lease the property has not lived up to it's full potential. It has been used by a hodgepodge of community leagues and sports teams with nearly no management and no controls in place. The fields are in disrepair, there is no recognizable organization and the areas which should be used for league play; are being used for recreational play by a very limited group of people and various organizations- The Non-Profit has been abble to negotiate and sign new 30 year lease. The team has also created a brand new non-profit organization name, The United States of America Institute Of Sports. 

Working together they will improve the park for future generations. It will open up to the entire community allowing sports and league play to an entire generation of residents in a 25 mile radius. The Jaycee Park currently consists of: 

  •  2 Football Fields
  • 2 Soccer Fields 
  • 1 Regulation Baseball Field
  • 3 Softball Fields
  • 2 Full Volleyball Sandcourts ( 1 more available)

(Former Giant Mike Alexander and McCann Utu touring the Jaycee Fields in Wilmington/Carson. After 3 years of waiting, a 30 year lease has been signed.)

(View from the Middle of the Football/ Soccer Fields. The fields need new Sod inserts to make them more presentable and ready for league play. Not necessarily expensive but time consuming and requires on site management which will be provided)


(The Restroom facilities above - The USAIOS plans are to create permanent restroom facilities for the parents and kids that will frequent the park)

(The sponsors on the baseball gates are unknown - plans are to centralize sponsor solicitations and organize them through a non - profit organization for the park. Sponsors will be organized to sponsor a) Fields, b) Sports c) Teams d) Improvements. All funds will be used to imrpove the park for future generations of South Bay Kids. 

(The park walkways, concrete stairs, and the strips and walkways all need to be refurbished and improved to create a look of a sports complex, not a run down park)

(The bleachers between the Football / Soccer Fields need to be painted. More bleachers need to be added to make it more for league play on weekend. Great Space for weekend tournaments. By this time next year it will be a vibrant plance to watch sports)

(All of the Graffiti around the park needs to be taken off the dumpsters and surrounding areas. The goals also need to be upgraded, netted and the areas where there are oil containers need to be decorated A huge improvement to the grounds and surrounding ) 

(The center of the Jaycee Fields walkway leading to the Wilmington Girls and Boys Clubs. There needs to be systemic cleaning contracts in place and the tree boxes painted white as well as new trash cans lining the well repaired and striped fields) 

(The central parking lot is never full due to lack of marketing and use by thousands of surrounding homes and High Schools that need it. With new slurry seal and striping, and a new entry way sign, this park is positioned to be the best outdoor sports park in South Bay Los Angeles. Organization and focus is needed to turn it around) 

( The Volleyball Sand Courts need to be re-sanded and the 3rd Sand Volleyball Court needs to be initiated to maximize this site. An excellent but underused asset of the park)

In 6 months, what has been lost for 39 years, can finally be put to good use for the entire community. "The Outdoor Sports" answer for the Children and High Schools, Leagues and Sports Organizations of South Bay Los Angeles.

The Jaycee Fields Sports Park will become The USA Institute Of Sports serving the South Bay area.

The children of the South Bay, primarily the areas of Wilmington and Carson are all currently being underserved. There are no outdoor sports outlets in the effective area of South Bay Los Angeles. The two main sports centers which are "Velocity" in the South Bay and the "American Sports Center" in Orange County have NO OUTDOOR FIELDS. Many organizations in the South Bay are renting fields, negotiating piece meal arrangements or simply cancelling leagues due to the lack of space. Not any longer. 

Former New York Giant Mike Alexander and his team have a plan to turn things around in 6 months. 

The team got  together 3 years ago for the benefit of the children in the community. McCann Utu Gary Kern and Mike Alexander put together their minds and efforts and created the United States Institute Of Sports. A non-profit foundation that will clean up the field, organize it for league and community use and eventually, transition it into a moder sports park and training facility benefting the youth of Los Angeles for future generations to come. They have spoken with architects, planners and have begun plans for 2017 and beyond to create what will be a modern indoor/outdoor sports park from the existing 18 acres. For the next 6 months; they will basically turn things around. 

ABOUT THE GUYS: 

McCann Lototele Utu-Born in American Samoa raised in Southern California. McCann Lettered for 3 years in Football at the University of Arizona with a background in Health Education. Currently managing a nationwide mobile massage service and products wellness company to corporation, conventions, trade shows, special events and sporting venues. Proud Father of two boys McCann Jr, & Josiah Utu. I am very proud of my football background and my Samoan heritage. Being an athlete has changed my life. An athlete, artist and educator for life. 

(McCann Utu Number 66 on the field)

Mike Alexander: Raised in Wilmington, CA.  Attended Banning High School played Football for three years. Attended San Diego State on a Football Scholarship. All Conference Center his senior year and graduated with a degree in criminal justice. Signed as a free agent contract with the New York Giants. Drafted by the Rhein Fire, and played for Coach Galen Hall (Emmitt Smith's college coach at Florida). After his pro career he started coaching football at Banning High School. Earned his Masters Degree, in human performance and sport, from New Mexico Highlands University. Currently Assistant Football Coach at Palos Verdes High School. He's  published a children's book, titled based  on his character "Coach Can" - Coach Can Fitness Fun. It is currently available on amazon.com. He continues to work with youth, and has conducted  non-contact  youth summer football camps,for the past five years.  He has been married to his wife for 20 years, and has three daughters, and a son. 

Why This Is So Important?

McCann Utu- CEO

In his own words: 

This project is important to me because sports have kept me mentally and physically healthy and helped me overcome obstacles in my life. It taught me how to work harder and fight for what I wanted to accomplish in my life. I’m still enduring and working toward my goal today. I strongle believe that this project will be able to help many youths in any community urban or suburban to make them better citizens in our society if they are taught early the ethics and morals of sports. In Addition, the importance of building character, also our eventual project will bring both sports and academics together to give our youth the opportunity to earn a scholarship to get an education. There’s no guarantee but every youth that takes advantage of our vision will gain something positive that will help them in shaping them become better person.

Mike Alexander- COO

In his own words:

This project is important to me, because the community of Wilmington, along with the surrounding communities, needs something like this. Our cleanup of the existing park and then our planned state of the art indoor/outdoor complex ,will afford more kids, more opportunities. We will be unique, in that we will service all student-athletes, boys and girls, and help them build the foundation and skills to be successful ,in both sports and in life. Our programs will stress student first, and athlete second. We will require that all of our participating student athletes, maintain a minimum grade point average, in order to take part In our programs. Those that are behind, but want to put forth the effort, will be helped, so that they can participate eventually. We will help teach discipline, work ethic, and respect, besides teaching the proper sports techniques, in order to help make  our student athletes more successful, in their chosen sport. Our programs will help guide all student athletes ,from the youth stage, through High School, with the goal of helping all of them, in getting academic, and athletic scholarships. There are many opportunities out there, and when I say that, I know that the reality is, that most kids, in any chosen sport, are not going to get Division 1 scholarships, but it is far from the end of the world. There are thousands of schools out there(D1, D2, D3, and so on). Kids need to know this, and be guided towards those opportunities. Our programs will focus on seeing all of our Student Athletes through ,the entire process. Everything we do, will be geared towards helping all of our kids achieve success well beyond high School.  There is nothing like what we will have to offer, in all of Southern California. We will be able to reach many kids ,and help afford them opportunities, they didn't know they had. 

Gary Kern- Chairman Of The Board:   

Gary Kern was born and raised in Wilmington, California he attended all of the schools, from Wilmington Jr. High to Banning High School to Harbor College to Cal State Long Beach. Most in the community know him from coaching the Banning High School softball team, directing Senior Programs or overseeing the 18 acre Jaycee Sports Park. “ There are only three Public parks in Wilmington. They have limited playing fields. If we are able to make the following improvements (mentioned in the campaign) to the Jaycee Fields. Wilmington Athletic Complex more Youth and Adults would have a safe environment to participate in well organized activities. By installing Lights and  Artificial Turf on all the fields we more than double the number of hours of use. I think we need to ask the Community to donate from $1.00 to $5.00 (at a time) if we can raise $50,000 we will have the seed money needed to start the process.” says Gary Kern. Mr. Kern is also a Vietnam Veteran drafted in 1966. 

WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL ACHIEVE: 

From McCann Utu:

Initially, we're looking for funds to just clean up the park and get it organized. Afterwards, were seeking corporations, private investors, Foundations, Professional organization & Athletes, Grants and any able person that will see the value of developing a complete vision of what a sports complex should provide for all youth sports along with a parent friendly environment for everyone. A Modern sports park in 2017 is the goal. 

    Our Organization is seeking $50,000 to develop and manage a team to seed this important venture. Eventually, we will developed sports and academic programs that will prepare our youth to the next level to college, trade & certifications schools, and other academic training. We will do that through sponsors, corporate partners and others. 

    The Funds will go to cleaning up and organizing the Jaycee Fields, a valuable part of the community of South Bay Los Angeles. It is needed now more than ever; the sports park is operating at 30% of it's capacity.

      The community will benefit from having an options in the community:

      We'll be able to offer the following services to all of the South Bay: 

      Football : Tackle Football, Flag Football Leagues, High School Football

      Soccer: Soccer Leages: Intramural Sports, High School Soccer, Clinics

      Baseball/Softball: Leagues, Intramural Sports, HS/College, Clinics

      Volleyball: Tournaments, Volleyball Leagues, Clinics, Intramural 

      Shareholders will feel a sense of pride and satisfaction about their contribution in creating a positive investment in the lives of many youths. It's not monetary, it's for the youth of the South Bay.

      I was a Co-Founder of another Sports group made up of former Professional Athletes, business men, coaches and volunteers which focused on football camps & clinic in the local communities. The organization became successful in bringing former and Professional athletes together to encourage and run football camp each year in various cities. The goal was to promote sports and academic for the community and encourage young men to work hard in school to prepare them for college or other trade schools. 

      With our USAIOS project we will have our own location to encompass all the sports not just football plus an academic/college bound program to add more value to our community.

      From Mike Alexander: 

      With contributions, we will be able to become a pillar , and a safe haven in the community ,for our Youth, and will be able to help guide and help them, so that they can realize dreams, they may have thought to be impossible. We will empower our youth. We will be able to positively impact our community of Wilmington, and all surrounding communities for years and years to come. We will be able to establish, and leave a  positive legacy, that will continue, long after we are gone. This will enable us to really give back, and make a difference.  Words almost cant describe the magnitude of the park and it's long term benefits to all.I believe these benefits, will go beyond anything I can even imagine at this point. That's how big this is . Bigger than me, or any one person involved.  I am humbled to have this opportunity, to be able to be a part of something, that will help so many for such a long period of time. This is my dream.

      What We Need

      We need $50,000 Dollars to make it all happen. For 6 months of work it's $2.77 a day, less than a large coffee and bagel at Starbucks. In order to make a difference. 

      The funding will go to three primary uses:

      1. Cleaning up the park, and organizing it for maximum use for the community.   

          a. Setting up a trailer in the center of the park for 6 months; use it as a central operations center for the management of the site. Make sure all of the "bro commerce" stops on the field and it's organized into a park that is well managed and run. 

         b. Begin the cleanup, repainting, re-striping and sod replacement on the fields. Refilling cracked sidewalks, replacing trash cans, overall, making the place look orderly and organized. 

         c.Begin Merchandise development - T- Shirts- Baseball hats, Hoodies and sell them to spur local awareness as well as raise funds for the cleanup effort. 

      2. Organize the park to become part of the Local Community. Make the park a valuable asset for the formation of leagues and sports initiatives in the local community of South Bay Los Angeles.

          a. Start a social media outreach program connect to the 25 nearest high schools, indoor sports parks, and football, soccer and volleyball leagues.

          b. Reach out to the Wilmington Boys and Girls Club nearby. Make them feel like part of the effort, coordinate fundraising and charity events with them as non-profit partners. 

          c. Work with the City of Wilmington, develop a plan that suits into what the parks and recreation department sees as the biggest need of the Carson/Wilmington area. 

      3. Create a Grand Opening Event to Showcase the New Park to the South Bay area.

          a. Through Social Media, develop a database of enthusiasts for the park and constantly send them updates every 30 days.

          b. Contact all of the VIP's in the area- get them excited about how this is benefiting the area youth.

          c. Start the design and construction renderings of the new layout and modern park that will take place in the future. Speak to sponsors about underwriting the development costs and seek financing simulteanously.

      (Concept Park from Architects. Over the next 12 months, the USAIOS working alongside corporate partners will develop a new vision for the Wilmington Sports Complex /Jaycee fields to create a USAIOS field for South Bay LA by 2017)

      What You Get

      Contributors to the USAIOS will get a ton of gear. Why? Because we love people that love kids. Everything from a Cartoon Caricature of yourself, to a Box Beaver, to Gym Bags, to Sport Coats to a membership on the board. Getting involved in the future of the children of South Bay Los Angeles is a dream that McCann Utu and Mike Alexander have shared for 3 years. We're thankful for every bit of support that we get. Most importantly, we hope to meet every contributor at our Grand Opening of the United States Institute Of Sports Park next August. Thank you, thank you, thank you!  

      The Impact

      It is incalculable how many kids will be able to now head outside and spend time playing sports, hanging out with parents, and learning a new way to live life. Sports teach 5 key things in life. 

      1. Discipline- Doing the right thing; especially when nobody is watching.

      2. Teamwork- Putting others ahead of yourself to reach a common goal.

      3. Pride- The pride of putting 110% into your efforts, every time. 

      4. Self Esteem - Sports accomplishments give children self worth. 

      5.   Education- Excellence in Sports usually translates to the Class Room.

      The most important lessons in life are FREE. 

      Mike Alexander and McCann Utu have built successful businesses and successful lives for themselves in the area. They have worked with children of all ages and most importantly, have been born and raised in the South Bay Los Angeles area. 

      You can drive down to 1700 Figueroa Street in Wilmington, CA and tour the 18 acre site for yourself. It is the perfect real estate site for the kids of Wilmington, CA. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Use the Indiegogo Share tools. Tell people about what we're doing and if you want to be a volunteer, we will be looking for volunteers when we get setup at the Park. You can get the information from our website www.usaios.com or email McCann@usaios.com and we will get you setup as a volunteer.

      We appreciate anything you can do. Open your hearts for the kids of the South Bay and the parents that take care of them. This is about creating a legacy that will outlive all of us. 

      With your support, we can create a new park for the community in just 6 months from today. Make a difference in a childs life. Thank you!! 

      (Shirts Available on The Website www.USAIOS.COM)
story_txt:
The 18 acre Jaycee Fields and Sports Park in Wilmington, the heart of South Bay Los Angeles is currently in disrepair. It needs to be saved for future generations. After 3 years of waiting. The Wilmington Jaycees Foundation has formed a new non-profit (The USAIOS) and signed a 30 year lease to save the park. A Former New York Giant and his team of locals from the area plan to turn things around. Below: a message from the President, McCann Utu.

Visit our Site: http://usaios.com/Visit our Facebook: http://on.fb.me/18NMVf2
The 18 acre Jaycee Fields Sports Park located at 1700 Figueroa Street in Wilmington, CA. It has an excellent location and facilities for outdoor sports. The property was originally leased to the Wilmington Jaycee Foundation 39 years ago in 3 year increments. Since it's original lease the property has not lived up to it's full potential. It has been used by a hodgepodge of community leagues and sports teams with nearly no management and no controls in place. The fields are in disrepair, there is no recognizable organization and the areas which should be used for league play; are being used for recreational play by a very limited group of people and various organizations- The Non-Profit has been abble to negotiate and sign new 30 year lease. The team has also created a brand new non-profit organization name, The United States of America Institute Of Sports. Working together they will improve the park for future generations. It will open up to the entire community allowing sports and league play to an entire generation of residents in a 25 mile radius. The Jaycee Park currently consists of: 
 2 Football Fields
2 Soccer Fields 
1 Regulation Baseball Field
3 Softball Fields
2 Full Volleyball Sandcourts ( 1 more available)
(Former Giant Mike Alexander and McCann Utu touring the Jaycee Fields in Wilmington/Carson. After 3 years of waiting, a 30 year lease has been signed.)(View from the Middle of the Football/ Soccer Fields. The fields need new Sod inserts to make them more presentable and ready for league play. Not necessarily expensive but time consuming and requires on site management which will be provided)(The Restroom facilities above - The USAIOS plans are to create permanent restroom facilities for the parents and kids that will frequent the park)(The sponsors on the baseball gates are unknown - plans are to centralize sponsor solicitations and organize them through a non - profit organization for the park. Sponsors will be organized to sponsor a) Fields, b) Sports c) Teams d) Improvements. All funds will be used to imrpove the park for future generations of South Bay Kids. (The park walkways, concrete stairs, and the strips and walkways all need to be refurbished and improved to create a look of a sports complex, not a run down park)(The bleachers between the Football / Soccer Fields need to be painted. More bleachers need to be added to make it more for league play on weekend. Great Space for weekend tournaments. By this time next year it will be a vibrant plance to watch sports)(All of the Graffiti around the park needs to be taken off the dumpsters and surrounding areas. The goals also need to be upgraded, netted and the areas where there are oil containers need to be decorated A huge improvement to the grounds and surrounding ) (The center of the Jaycee Fields walkway leading to the Wilmington Girls and Boys Clubs. There needs to be systemic cleaning contracts in place and the tree boxes painted white as well as new trash cans lining the well repaired and striped fields) (The central parking lot is never full due to lack of marketing and use by thousands of surrounding homes and High Schools that need it. With new slurry seal and striping, and a new entry way sign, this park is positioned to be the best outdoor sports park in South Bay Los Angeles. Organization and focus is needed to turn it around) ( The Volleyball Sand Courts need to be re-sanded and the 3rd Sand Volleyball Court needs to be initiated to maximize this site. An excellent but underused asset of the park)In 6 months, what has been lost for 39 years, can finally be put to good use for the entire community. "The Outdoor Sports" answer for the Children and High Schools, Leagues and Sports Organizations of South Bay Los Angeles.The Jaycee Fields Sports Park will become The USA Institute Of Sports serving the South Bay area.The children of the South Bay, primarily the areas of Wilmington and Carson are all currently being underserved. There are no outdoor sports outlets in the effective area of South Bay Los Angeles. The two main sports centers which are "Velocity" in the South Bay and the "American Sports Center" in Orange County have NO OUTDOOR FIELDS. Many organizations in the South Bay are renting fields, negotiating piece meal arrangements or simply cancelling leagues due to the lack of space. Not any longer. Former New York Giant Mike Alexander and his team have a plan to turn things around in 6 months. The team got  together 3 years ago for the benefit of the children in the community. McCann Utu Gary Kern and Mike Alexander put together their minds and efforts and created the United States Institute Of Sports. A non-profit foundation that will clean up the field, organize it for league and community use and eventually, transition it into a moder sports park and training facility benefting the youth of Los Angeles for future generations to come. They have spoken with architects, planners and have begun plans for 2017 and beyond to create what will be a modern indoor/outdoor sports park from the existing 18 acres. For the next 6 months; they will basically turn things around. ABOUT THE GUYS: McCann Lototele Utu-Born in
American Samoa raised in Southern California. McCann Lettered for 3 years in Football at the
University of Arizona with a background in Health Education. Currently managing
a nationwide mobile massage service and products wellness company to
corporation, conventions, trade shows, special events and sporting venues.
Proud Father of two boys McCann Jr, & Josiah Utu. I am very proud of my football background and my Samoan heritage. Being an athlete has changed my life. An athlete, artist and educator for life. (McCann Utu Number 66 on the field)Mike Alexander: Raised in Wilmington, CA.  Attended Banning High
School played Football for three years. Attended San Diego State on a Football Scholarship. All Conference Center his senior year and graduated with a degree in criminal justice. Signed as a free agent contract with the New York Giants. Drafted by the Rhein Fire, and played for Coach Galen
Hall (Emmitt Smith's college coach at Florida). After his pro career he started
coaching football at Banning High School. Earned his Masters Degree, in human
performance and sport, from New Mexico Highlands University. Currently Assistant Football Coach at Palos Verdes High School. He's  published a children's book, titled based  on his character "Coach Can" - Coach Can Fitness Fun. It is currently
available on amazon.com. He continues to work with youth, and has conducted  non-contact  youth summer football camps,for the past five
years.  He has been married to his wife for 20 years, and has three
daughters, and a son. Why This Is So Important?McCann Utu- CEOIn his own words: This project is important to
me because sports have kept me mentally and physically healthy and helped me
overcome obstacles in my life. It taught me how to work harder and fight for
what I wanted to accomplish in my life. I’m still enduring and working toward
my goal today. I strongle believe that this project will be able to help many
youths in any community urban or suburban to make them better citizens in our
society if they are taught early the ethics and morals of sports. In Addition, the importance of building character, also our eventual project will bring both sports
and academics together to give our youth the opportunity to earn a
scholarship to get an education. There’s no guarantee but every youth that
takes advantage of our vision will gain something positive that will help them
in shaping them become better person.Mike Alexander- COOIn his own words:This project is
important to me, because the community of Wilmington, along with the
surrounding communities, needs something like this. Our cleanup of the existing park and then our planned state of the art
indoor/outdoor complex ,will afford more kids, more opportunities. We will be
unique, in that we will service all student-athletes, boys and girls, and help
them build the foundation and skills to be successful ,in both sports and in
life. Our programs will stress student first, and athlete second. We will
require that all of our participating student athletes, maintain a minimum
grade point average, in order to take part In our programs. Those that are
behind, but want to put forth the effort, will be helped, so that they can
participate eventually. We will help teach discipline, work ethic, and respect,
besides teaching the proper sports techniques, in order to help make  our
student athletes more successful, in their chosen sport. Our programs will help
guide all student athletes ,from the youth stage, through High School, with the
goal of helping all of them, in getting academic, and athletic scholarships.
There are many opportunities out there, and when I say that, I know that the
reality is, that most kids, in any chosen sport, are not going to get Division
1 scholarships, but it is far from the end of the world. There are thousands of
schools out there(D1, D2, D3, and so on). Kids need to know this, and be guided
towards those opportunities. Our programs will focus on seeing all of our
Student Athletes through ,the entire process. Everything we do, will be geared
towards helping all of our kids achieve success well beyond high School.
 There is nothing like what we will have to offer, in all of Southern
California. We will be able to reach many kids ,and help afford them
opportunities, they didn't know they had. Gary Kern- Chairman Of The Board:   Gary
Kern was born and raised in Wilmington, California he attended all of
the schools, from Wilmington Jr. High to Banning High School to
Harbor College to Cal State Long Beach. Most in the community know
him from coaching the Banning High School softball team, directing
Senior Programs or overseeing the 18 acre Jaycee Sports Park. “
There
are only three Public parks in Wilmington. They have limited playing
fields. If we are able to make the following improvements (mentioned
in the campaign) to the Jaycee Fields. Wilmington Athletic Complex more Youth and
Adults would have a safe environment to participate in well organized
activities. By installing Lights and  Artificial Turf on all the
fields we more than double the number of hours of use. I think we
need to ask the Community to donate from $1.00 to $5.00 (at a time) if
we can raise $50,000 we will have the seed money needed to start the
process.” says Gary Kern. Mr. Kern is also a Vietnam Veteran
drafted in 1966. 
WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL ACHIEVE: From McCann Utu:Initially, we're looking for funds to just clean up the park and get it organized. Afterwards, were seeking corporations,
private investors, Foundations, Professional organization & Athletes,
Grants and any able person that will see the value of developing a complete
vision of what a sports complex should provide for all youth sports along with
a parent friendly environment for everyone. A Modern sports park in 2017 is the goal. Our Organization is seeking $50,000 to develop and manage a team to seed this important venture. Eventually, we will developed sports and academic programs that will prepare our youth to the next
level to college, trade & certifications schools, and other academic
training. We will do that through sponsors, corporate partners and others. 
The Funds will go to cleaning up and organizing the Jaycee Fields, a valuable part of the community of South Bay Los Angeles. It is needed now more than ever; the sports park is operating at 30% of it's capacity.The community will benefit
from having an options in the community:We'll be able to offer the following services to all of the South Bay: Football : Tackle Football, Flag Football Leagues, High School FootballSoccer: Soccer Leages: Intramural Sports, High School Soccer, ClinicsBaseball/Softball: Leagues, Intramural Sports, HS/College, ClinicsVolleyball: Tournaments, Volleyball Leagues, Clinics, Intramural 
Shareholders will feel a
sense of pride and satisfaction about their contribution in creating a positive
investment in the lives of many youths. It's not monetary, it's for the youth of the South Bay.
I
was a Co-Founder of another Sports group made up of former Professional
Athletes, business men, coaches and volunteers which focused on football camps
& clinic in the local communities. The organization became successful in
bringing former and Professional athletes together to encourage and run
football camp each year in various cities. The goal was to promote sports and
academic for the community and encourage young men to work hard in school to
prepare them for college or other trade schools. With our USAIOS project we
will have our own location to encompass all the sports not just football plus
an academic/college bound program to add more value to our community.From Mike Alexander: With contributions, we
will be able to become a pillar , and a safe haven in the community ,for our
Youth, and will be able to help guide and help them, so that they can realize
dreams, they may have thought to be impossible. We will empower our youth. We
will be able to positively impact our community of Wilmington, and all
surrounding communities for years and years to come. We will be able to
establish, and leave a  positive legacy, that will continue, long after we
are gone. This will enable us to really give back, and make a difference.
 Words almost cant describe the magnitude of the park and it's long term
benefits to all.I believe these benefits, will go beyond anything I can even
imagine at this point. That's how big this is . Bigger than me, or any one
person involved.  I am humbled to have this opportunity, to be able to be
a part of something, that will help so many for such a long period of time. This is my dream.What We NeedWe need $50,000 Dollars to make it all happen. For 6 months of work it's $2.77 a day, less than a large coffee and bagel at Starbucks. In order to make a difference. The funding will go to three primary uses:1. Cleaning up the park, and organizing it for maximum use for the community.       a. Setting up a trailer in the center of the park for 6 months; use it as a central operations center for the management of the site. Make sure all of the "bro commerce" stops on the field and it's organized into a park that is well managed and run.    b. Begin the cleanup, repainting, re-striping and sod replacement on the fields. Refilling cracked sidewalks, replacing trash cans, overall, making the place look orderly and organized.    c.Begin Merchandise development - T- Shirts- Baseball hats, Hoodies and sell them to spur local awareness as well as raise funds for the cleanup effort. 2. Organize the park to become part of the Local Community. Make the park a valuable asset for the formation of leagues and sports initiatives in the local community of South Bay Los Angeles.    a. Start a social media outreach program connect to the 25 nearest high schools, indoor sports parks, and football, soccer and volleyball leagues.    b. Reach out to the Wilmington Boys and Girls Club nearby. Make them feel like part of the effort, coordinate fundraising and charity events with them as non-profit partners.     c. Work with the City of Wilmington, develop a plan that suits into what the parks and recreation department sees as the biggest need of the Carson/Wilmington area. 3. Create a Grand Opening Event to Showcase the New Park to the South Bay area.    a. Through Social Media, develop a database of enthusiasts for the park and constantly send them updates every 30 days.    b. Contact all of the VIP's in the area- get them excited about how this is benefiting the area youth.    c. Start the design and construction renderings of the new layout and modern park that will take place in the future. Speak to sponsors about underwriting the development costs and seek financing simulteanously.(Concept Park from Architects. Over the next 12 months, the USAIOS working alongside corporate partners will develop a new vision for the Wilmington Sports Complex /Jaycee fields to create a USAIOS field for South Bay LA by 2017)What You GetContributors to the USAIOS will get a ton of gear. Why? Because we love people that love kids. Everything from a Cartoon Caricature of yourself, to a Box Beaver, to Gym Bags, to Sport Coats to a membership on the board. Getting involved in the future of the children of South Bay Los Angeles is a dream that McCann Utu and Mike Alexander have shared for 3 years. We're thankful for every bit of support that we get. Most importantly, we hope to meet every contributor at our Grand Opening of the United States Institute Of Sports Park next August. Thank you, thank you, thank you!  The ImpactIt is incalculable how many kids will be able to now head outside and spend time playing sports, hanging out with parents, and learning a new way to live life. Sports teach 5 key things in life. 1. Discipline- Doing the right thing; especially when nobody is watching.2. Teamwork- Putting others ahead of yourself to reach a common goal.3. Pride- The pride of putting 110% into your efforts, every time. 4. Self Esteem - Sports accomplishments give children self worth. 5.   Education- Excellence in Sports usually translates to the Class Room.The most important lessons in life are FREE. Mike Alexander and McCann Utu have built successful businesses and successful lives for themselves in the area. They have worked with children of all ages and most importantly, have been born and raised in the South Bay Los Angeles area. You can drive down to 1700 Figueroa Street in Wilmington, CA and tour the 18 acre site for yourself. It is the perfect real estate site for the kids of Wilmington, CA. Other Ways You Can HelpUse the Indiegogo Share tools. Tell people about what we're doing and if you want to be a volunteer, we will be looking for volunteers when we get setup at the Park. You can get the information from our website www.usaios.com or email McCann@usaios.com and we will get you setup as a volunteer.We appreciate anything you can do. Open your hearts for the kids of the South Bay and the parents that take care of them. This is about creating a legacy that will outlive all of us. With your support, we can create a new park for the community in just 6 months from today. Make a difference in a childs life. Thank you!! (Shirts Available on The Website www.USAIOS.COM)

story:
21 DAYS to Raise $11,700 to Train 300 Intervention Caregivers in 2014! 

Summary

My name is Kenneth Koon.  I am a U.S. Army Reserve Chaplain (commissioned in 1991) and most recently, the Executive Director of Armed Forces Mission (AFM).  Armed Forces Mission was founded in November 2012 as a result of my work with more than 22,000 soldiers and veterans over the prior two years, many of whom were struggling with suicidal ideation. As I write these words, 11 December 2013, my heart is heavy for three soldiers I have intervened for in the past 48 hours.  They are safe for now, but so many more do not get help and feel as if they are all alone.  AFM’s mission is “Building Resilience and Restoring Hope”.  Our vision is “Serving America’s Armed Forces, our Veterans and our Nation to strengthen both military and civilian communities” Our campaign theme from inception is STAND WITH THEM.  That’s what we invite you to do through your support of Armed Forces Mission!

Our flagship program is the “I WILL INTERVENE CHALLENGE,,” a two-day suicide intervention workshop that gives caregivers from all walks of life the skills to intervene for those at risk.  The curriculum we utilize is Applied Suicide Intervention Skills Training (ASIST). ASIST has been rated as the #1 intervention training model worldwide for more than 30 years. 

In our first 12 months, AFM has had the opportunity to build resilience and provide encouragement for 500 service members and their families.  We have also trained 85 Community Gatekeepers within both the military and civilian communities in suicide intervention.  However, so many more need the training. 

Our goal in 2014 is to provide life-saving skills to 300 Community Gatekeepers …advocates of intervention... across all segments of society (military, civilian and veteran) to be there in the units, and in the civilian places of business, on the ball fields and in the churches.  To accomplish this mission we are forming the full-time Office of Training and Intervention, staffed by a dedicated group of trainers with a passion for making a difference. 

With your help, we can continue to Stand With Them!

The Impact

Three of many stories I could tell you illustrate how lives are changed because of training.  Lynn is a retired Navy Commander.  He received a call 16 days after taking the workshop.  He said, “Because of the workshop, I realized the person I was talking with was suicidal.  I discovered that she had attempted suicide three days earlier.  She was on the verge of a second attempt.  I did a three-way with the Crisis Hotline and got her the immediate help she needed.”

Rebecca’s son took his life in January.  She was not sure if she was ready for the training, but she decided that she wanted to make a difference and enrolled in the November workshop.  During a simulation exercise on the second day of training, Rebecca was helping a person at risk come off the symbolic bridge of hopelessness.  Other particpants had tried before her.  But she stayed at it and was able to help the person at risk to come down off the bridge.  In her own words, “The Workshop has helped give me a voice to end the epidemic of suicide – one person at a time – whoever God brings in my path.”

Lewis had experienced multiple losses of friends from suicide.  He was himself overwhelmed by his own thoughts.  He said, “Because of the workshop I have found purpose in my pain and passion for living again to make a difference for those who struggle.”

In addition to the many community members who want to gain the skills to intervene in their day-to-day interactions with others, licensed professional counselors and social workers enjoy the Continuing Education credits received for completion of the "I Will Intervene" workshop.  The fact is, many professionals will readily admit that they too have a difficult time discussing the subject prior to attending the workshop, despite their professional training.  However, after attending the workshop, they feel empowered to truly make a difference for those at risk.

The Value of Your Contribution

Words cannot describe the value your contribution makes.  What is the value of a life saved from the pit of despair?  What price can we put on a dad remaining alive to read bedtime stories to his child?  How much is it worth to provide support for someone who thought they were all alone? 

My name is Kenneth “Lewis” Koon.  I am the Lewis who had lost hope, but because others took the time to invest in me, my life was saved and the door was opened for me to reach the thousands I have worked with over the past three years.  I know others like me are all around us.  Many individuals take the workshop because they simply want to make a difference.  Still others sense that the workshop is “calling them” to engage more fully in their life's purpose or to respond out of their own experiences of loss or even their own struggle to stay alive.  Through their pain, we will help them find their passion so that thousands more can be saved. 

What We Need

The trademarked training materials from Livingworks Inc. cost AFM $39 per participant.  In 2013, 95% of contributions given went to keeping the participant cost as low as possible.  More than 2000 volunteer hours were contributed, but the need is for a full-time staff to conduct the training and to personally intervene. 

  • Funding of the Stand With Them Campaign will underwrite the training of participants in I WILL INTERVENE workshops.
  • The Stand With Them Campaign also underwrites AFM public awareness of the training and available services and raises awareness regarding the issue of suicide.  Suicide is the "pink elephant" in the room that very few are willing to talk about.  However, through a concerted effort of public awareness, the word is getting out.  People are being trained and lives are being saved. 

Our partners will be recognized for their contribution in print, internet and radio through our Community Alliance Program.  In this initial indiegogo.com friend-and-fund raising effort, we are seeking to raise $11,700 by New Year's Eve, just a few short days from now.  The funds will cover the cost of training materials for the 300 gatekeepers we seek to train in 2014. 

In the event that we do not make this initial goal, we will purchase as many sets of materials as possible and continue to move forward toward our total Stand With Them Campaign goal of $250,000 for 2014.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, we still have many ways you can help.  For starters, you can share the AFM mission with your social network.  We need community advocates for the cause who can help get the word out. 

Secondly, you can attend an "I WILL INTERVENE Workshop" or help organize one in your community.  We have held these workshops for churches, community organizations and employers because of advocates who helped spark community interest.  Typically, we like to have 20 to 30 participants per workshop.  The workshop is a two-day program; 60 to 90 days of prep time are needed to publicize the event. 

Because of the tremendous support of many individuals, families, and Community Alliance Partners, AFM was able to celebrate the achievement of all of our first year goals for 2013 and to exceed our goals in some areas.  With your help we can do even more in 2014. 

Together we can Stand With Them for safer and stronger communities,

Chaplain Kenneth Koon

Executive Director

of advocates who helped spark community interest.  Typically, we like to have 20 to 30
participants per workshop.  The workshop
is a two-day program; 60 to 90 days of prep time are needed to publicize the event.  
Because of the tremendous support of many
individuals, families, and Community Alliance Partners, AFM was able to
celebrate the achievement of all of our first year goals for 2013 and to exceed our goals in some areas.  With your help we can do even
more in 2014.  
Together we can Stand With Them for safer
and stronger communities,
Chaplain Kenneth KoonExecutive Director

story:
Jan 24, 2014 UPDATE:

Thank you for all the generous support in helping us not only reach, but also exceed our initial fundraising goal! We are very excited to see so many people making a conscientious effort to become a part of the process of building Philanthropy in Motion. In only the span of one month, your contributions have demonstrated that there is a need for programs that empower a younger generation to engage in intelligent giving. With the additional funding, we have decided to offer two elements that will significantly enhance the quality of Model Foundation. 

Financial Aid: To go in line with our vision to make philanthropy accessible to all young people, we want to offer financial aid packages to students to offset travel and other costs.  

                            

Philanthropy in Motion Fellowship:  To encourage young people to gain a deeper, first-hand understanding of the social sector, PIM plans to offer a fellowship to a student who has gone through our philanthropy training and would like to serve full-time at a nonprofit over the summer. This fellowship offers a 1500 USD stipend for the PIM fellow to pursue a two-month internship. In addition, the PIM fellow will receive mentorship and coaching about social impact as well as professional development.  We hope that by creating a fellowship, PIM can build the capacity of select individuals who have demonstrated a commitment to public interest, preparing them for careers that promote philanthropy education. 

There are still 27 days left to the campaign, so please help us keep up this spectacular momentum to give students improved access to our program and exposure to hands-on philanthropic engagement. 

Philanthropy in Motion (PIM) is an organization that provides young people with the funds, training, and networks to become intelligent givers. PIM is founded by a team of Yale, Harvard, Cornell, and Peking University graduates who care deeply about fostering a consciousness for social responsibility in developing countries such as China. Using the philanthropic education model developed at Yale and other leading American universities as a basis, we design programs to fit the Chinese context. Through PIM, young people converge in forums to evaluate China-based non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and allocate collective resources to the ones that they deem to be the most innovative and impactful. 

We need to raise 13,000 USD to launch our biggest project to date: Model Foundation. Model Foundation is an inter-university conference that brings together students from across China, Hong Kong, Singapore, and the United States to take concerted action in identifying and supporting worthwhile nonprofit initiatives. A sponsor has committed to match each dollar we are able to raise from the public. Please support us in empowering young people to become the next generation of charitable givers and change-makers. 

Model Foundation

This summer, PIM will partner with the University of Hong Kong (HKU) to launch Model Foundation, a four-day conference that brings together university students to learn about and engage in intelligent charitable giving through making strategic decisions on how to distribute a PIM fund of 20,000 USD.

Acting as Grant Committee Officers, student representatives from Hong Kong, China, U.S., and Singapore will be charged with selecting and assessing local nonprofits for potential funding. As a group, they will participate in a roundtable discussion and come up with a strategy to allocate a sum of 20,000 USD to organizations that they deem to be addressing youth development in a unique, innovative, and impactful way. Workshops on contemporary approaches to philanthropy, interviews with social sector leaders, and site visits to these organizations will help inform their final decision, which will then be judged by a panel of experienced philanthropists and social sector leaders for the thoroughness of evaluation and rigor of analysis.

Through providing a platform for cross-cultural exchange and exploring approaches to effective giving, Model Foundation will raise the level of awareness and discourse about the social sector. Through providing a PIM fund, students form an actual young people's foundation with the power -- and also the responsibilities -- to make real impact. Students will gain a firm understanding of the inner workings of a foundation as they build leadership, analytical, and consensus-building skills. By learning and giving together in support of social projects, they enrich the communities in which they live as well as their personal lives and networks. 

Where The Funds Will Go

Why China? Why PIM?

Imagine a typical student named Liang. He comes from a middle class Chinese family, and through hard work, now attends a good university in Beijing. Other than pursuing his studies, he wants to help his local community. But overwhelmed by the vast landscape of NGOs in China, news reports regarding misuse of public donations, and his general sense that his efforts alone cannot change much, he drops the idea of supporting an NGO and instead focuses more intensely on academics. 

Liang eventually graduates from university and starts a well-paying job at an investment bank in Shanghai. Over the course of his career at the firm he saves some money, and it occurs to him again to donate a portion of his savings to the causes he cares about. He wishes that there were some way for him to connect with other young professionals in China, to gather, exchange, and discuss ideas about trustworthy organizations that addresses causes they care about. 

Realizing that there is no such organization, and moreover being reminded again of the fact that he by himself will not be able to make the kind of impact his boss (who had recently donated millions to a famous organization) would make, Liang decides to focus on his job, hoping that eventually he will be as wealthy as his boss so that he himself can also become a philanthropist.

Many young people in China, whether university students or young professionals, miss the chance to support social causes early in their lives. Moreover, they do not realize that collectively over time they could make an even larger impact than a single high net-worth donor or a corporation might make. In fact, most charitable donations in China come from corporations (57%) and a comparatively small percentage (32%) comes from individuals, compared to the US (73%). Our goal is to motivate more individuals in China to become more engaged in contributing to the social sector. 

                         

Source: China Charity Donation Resource Center, Giving USA

While there is a growing trend of charitable giving in China (see graph below), the overall quality of the philanthropic system lags behind due to 1) low public understanding, 2) lack of trust, and 3) insufficient support for independent small and medium NGOs.

                         

Source: China Charity Donation Resource Center

Many people want to help, but there are barriers preventing them from taking the first step. PIM is here to show young people like Liang that anyone and everyone in China can be a philanthropist! They can achieve more together by pooling together resources to collectively invest in trustable NGOs in a strategic manner. 

Let's look the etymology of the word "philanthropy." Its roots harken back to ancient Greek civilization and it literally means: "For the love of humanity." So it is our mission to teach young people that philanthropy is much more than the exclusive act of writing million dollar checks by a handful of wealthy people who have the power to do so, but it is about building a community and showing compassion. 

We will help young people in China 1) identify the best NGOs to donate to, 2) discuss with a group of people from diverse backgrounds to devise a strategically sound, sustainable methodology, and 3) contribute their resources, including time, money, and skills, to maximize their social impact.

With our vision to make philanthropy accessible, we will bridge the gap between the rising young professional class and a vast landscape of NGOs so as to awaken a common consciousness for intelligent giving among a new generation of young people, in a nation that with its economic power will soon bear the Asian status quo.


Three Ways You Can Help!

1. Donate to PIM

2. Join our Team  

3. Spread the Word


Our Team


                                                                 

Jasmine Lau

is the Co-Founder of PIM. Hailing from Hong Kong, she studied Economics at Yale. Upon graduating cum laude in 2012, she worked at Narada Foundation to build the capacity of grassroots social entrepreneurs and NGOs in China before pursuing a Masters of International Affairs at Peking University. Jasmine also runs Ember, a charitable organization she launched in 2007 that supports girls education in rural China.

                                                                   

Connie Leong

is the Co-Founder of PIM. Born and raised in New York, she graduated from Yale 2012, with distinction in both Political Science and East Asian Studies. As her senior thesis, she researched international NGOs in rural China. She continued her studies at Tsinghua University under the Richard U. Light Fellowship.

                                                                  

Fedor Deichmann 

holds a B.A. in Political Science with distinction from Yale University ‘11. After working as an Analyst in the M&A group at Lazard in Europe, he moved to Taiwan to found English Arcade, an online English school that envisions to democratize English education in Asia.

                                                                

Joyce Zheng

grew up in Yong'an and Fuzhou in Fujian province and double majored in International Studies and Diplomacy at China Foreign Affairs University '13. She is currently pursuing a Masters in Public Administration focusing on nonprofit management at Cornell University.

                                                                

Ashwin Kaja

hails from East Fishkill, New York, and studied at Harvard ’07 and Harvard Law School ’11.  He is a lawyer at Hogan Lovells at the Beijing office, as well as the founder of Investours, a nonprofit organization that combines microfinance with educational tourism. 

                                     

                                             Like us on Facebook!

                     For any further inquiries contact info@pimchina.org

story:
Do you care about children?

Do you want to give 74 girls and boys an experience they'll treasure for
the rest of their lives?

These children have lost everything. Their school was smashed to pieces by
the 2011 Tohoku tsunami. But with your help we can turn everything around.

Please make a contribution to the Sports Festival we are organizing. Just
click "CONTRIBUTE NOW" on the right hand side, or choose which one of the
3 presents you want.

We need to raise 200,000 yen to help the parents organize and provide
lunch for the 74 students and 176 parents, grandparents, teachers and
coaches of the Togura district. So they can have their sports festival
this year. We want to provide lunch boxes, juice/tea, BBQ grills, hot dogs
and to pay for transportation.

Let's cheer them up and let them know they are not forgotten and
that they can indeed survive this and will one day be able to rebuild a
school with their town's name on the entrance.

We'll bring the smiles from you that will say to them: "Don't give up.
Keep your head up."

Even in the hardest times there's family, traditions and a future worth
fighting for. Yes, even a simple BBQ can convey a message that strong.
Even more, by empowering the parents and giving them opportunities to make their children laugh and play together, we are supporting the
re-connection and rebuilding of strong communities. Remember, these are
the children who will be rebuilding Tohoku.


Frequently Asked Questions
(1) Why is a Sports Festival so Important?
In Japan the Sports Fesitval (Undokai) is one of the most important
milestones in childhood. It will be tragic if these children are robbed of
such an important event this year.

(2) Who Are The Children I'm Helping?
The 74 students at Togura Elementary School are girls and boys aged 6-12
years old. But your contribution also gives energy, hope and happiness to
176 parents, grandparents, teachers and coaches of the Togura district.

(3) Does All of My Contribution Help the Children?
Yes! Every penny you give goes directly to the Sports Festival. Two
anonymous donors have kindly offered to pay for the "perks" and the fees
that Indiegogo charge us. So everything you give will go to the children.

(4) I Can't Give Much, Does My Contribution Still Make a Difference?
YES! Even a small contribution helps greatly. For eample, just 10 dollars
will pay for lunch for 3 children. And there's another way your
contribution helps. It inspires other people to give too. So please give
whatever you can afford, you'll be amazed at how far your gift can go.

(5) Who is Running this Campaign?
We are OGA, a non-profit, non-religious group working in northern Japan to
help the victims of the 2011 earthquake and tsunami. [Note: OGA is legally
registered as an NPO in Japan]

We've been supporting communities here and helping rebuild jobs &
livelihoods for parents. We've coordinated with the local residents on things like:

  • Christmas presents
  • English classes
  • Computer classes
  • Exchange programs
  • Summer camps
  • Concerts
  • Festivals

And we've done our best to funnel support to a town that is still on the edge the very of survival.

For this project we're working closely with Mr. Sakamoto, vice principle of Togura Elementary School.

(6) What happened to Togura Elementary School in the Earthquake?
When the 9.0 magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of Japan, teachers
at Togura Elementary School in Minamisanriku Town, Miyagi Prefecture,
grabbed their students and ran for the hills.

The school, just 100 meters from the ocean, was engulfed by a massive
tsunami. The tidal wave soon reached the students where they had
evacuated. The teachers frantically got them to even higher ground
where they finally found safety. The school was reduced to an
unrecognizable heap of metal and seaweed.

6 months later the Togura students returned to class, studying on the
first floor of their neighboring town's Elementary School ever since.

As only 5 houses survived the powerful waves, the majority of parents from
Togura are forced to work and live in temporary housing in Sanuma (a city about one hour away by car from the school).  Many parents hold jobs as far away as Sendai (92.3 km).

Life continues to be a struggle, and as the years pass, families remain in
a state of limbo- with no home, no school, no town! This year suddenly the
funding for the Sports Festival fell through and they are on the very verge having to cancel!

(7) If you reach the goal, what will the extra money be used for?
Any extra money will go to the OGA Kids' Fund. The fund will pay for projects such as:

  • Children's flower bouquets on graduation
  • A summer camp in English(no school means lots of time at home but these kids don't have a home)
  • Special treats at Christmas.
  • A new swing set for the kindergarten
  • Field trips to museums
  • Supporting local family-based festivals
  • Baby sitting for mothers who need a few hours to themselves(There's still no supermarket here so parents must drive one hour to buy groceries)
  • Summer scholarship opportunities to the high school children- with local fishermen and farming business

These are all things most of us can take for granted. But when a violent disaster strikes it destroys everything. And the people of Tohoku just need a bit of our help to get a real hope for the future again.

Please contribute now and spread this campaign on our behalf and on behalf
of the 250 families of Togura. Thank you!

Angela Ortiz, Representative Director of OGA For Aid

story:
Innovative Adapter creates Smoking Drinks for a KID Lab Themed Party or a Epic Adult Halloween Party. Also use it as a high powered AIR DUSTER for your cars nook and crannies. 

 

Breakthrough System is Safe and Simple to Use

 

Liberty, Missouri – Jan 27, 2015 – After twelve years of research and development, Peter Nielsen created the smoking drink system. It is the first ever patented system that makes smoking drinks using liquid CO2. He finished developing the final prototype and has created an IndieGoGo campaign to help fund manufacturing and distribution. 

 For Kids or the Kid in you! Drinking from a cool smoky glass is growing in popularity. It is one of the most photographed drinks on the market. Prominent nightclubs and bars use them to enhance the customer experience that is more memorable and enjoyable. It was also featured at the Playboy mansion parties and now popular with Kids lab themed Birthday parties! 

 

The way the smoking drink system works is dry ice snow is injected directly into the bottom compartment of the patented cup. By separating it in its own compartment, individuals can safely pour and drink any beverage they want. The moment the drink comes in contact with the dry ice it releases vapor into the air to create the smoke and also chill the drink. 

 

Never before has there been such an easy and simply way to create cool smoky drinks. Individuals who want to create this themselves would only need to buy the vapor cups and vapor cup adapter that attaches to the soda stream CO2 or any CO2 tank. When the tank is inverted liquid CO2 is converted to dry ice powder. People can buy the CO2 tanks at Wal-Mart or Target for only $15 dollars. Using this patented technology, the dry ice will be injected into the bottom chamber of the cup so people no longer have to manually handle dry ice. This is a much faster and safe way to create the cool smoky potion!

 

By offering smoky glasses provides an unforgettable WOW factor to make people remember the business and want to come back. Also, individuals who want to throw an epic party can add this to entertain guests and keep kids amused for hours. With this one adapter that costs only $19.95, it can improve anyone’s drinking experience and bring it to a completely different level. 


Then when your done partying and your friends have dropped chips and bread crumbs in your car. Use it as a high powered Air Duster!


So far Peter has funded the entire project to research and develop the final prototype. However, he needs help to buy the right tooling and place minimum production orders to keep the project going. For those who want to see this incredible system available in the market, make a contribution today at their IndieGoGo campaign. The goal is to reach $100,000 by March 26, 2015. Do not wait any longer and buy a smoky shot glass system today! 

 

To show appreciation for the support, backers will receive great rewards. Anyone who contributes $20 will receive the complete system, which has the adapter and 20 reusable smoking party cups!

story:
What we need

There are Justhours left to our campaign closing, and we  want to get passed our target with your help, all you need to do  is click on the Donate Now Perk and donate $200 or more.

 Our next Yes! Youth 9 day leadership training course wich is scheduled for the 15th November. We need a minimum of R120 000 ($10 255) for the training to take place (30 youth at R4000- $345- per youth). Every Little bit helps!

 Most of Yes!Youth participants cannot afford to pay for the training, and need full or partial sponsorship. 

Support this campaign and help us train more youth to become active citizens.

What we do

We believe that Youth have the energy and desire for a better world; by directing this energy towards positive transformation within themselves and where they live, we are building healthy, happy and self-sufficient communities. 

Yes!Youth is a year-long mentorship programme that starts with a 9 day intensive training leadership foundation course. It provides Youth with the tools, training and support to live and stand for human values whilst developing initiatives they are passionate about and that meet the needs of communities. Yes!Youth is run under the umbrella of the International Association for Human Values (IAHV).


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant back the project right now you can help us in the following ways

  • Download our logo here, and save it as your Facebook profile picture, share the campaign link as your status by using the campaign share tools.
  •  If you have more time, email the campaign link to your own networks or send to those you know who may be keen to help. 
  • Make a phone call or share the news of the project in conversation with your colleagues and friends.
  • If you would like to join our campaign team drop us a line and let us know info@yesyouth.org.za

story:
This is the work of Roxie Jane Hunt who is hosting the colour workshop March 18th [picture below]. She inspires me not only with her creativity and skill but with her philosophy on the art of transformation, her politics, and her care and respect for her craft and her clients. I pester her on social media from time to time for the divine secrets of the colour wheel. Being able to support her work and bring some of her magic to mine and to my amazing community (and then the world!) would be a dream come true.

Right? It's literally magic.

Being a hairdresser, for me, is about creating a practice centred around play and adventure that is safe from judgement and is as physically and financially accessible as possible - especially to my LGBTQ+ community. Somewhere we can start to release our exhausting defences and venture into the parts of ourselves that hold our greatest potential for transformation. We adorn ourselves with the beautiful rainbow goo from which we came. [Pictured below].

 I have learned so much working as a hairstylist for the last 3 years with clients who have kept me inspired with their trust, vision, and bravery - but there is so much more to learn. Which is why I am reaching out to you for some help!

It feels terrifying to ask. It means accepting that the thing I want to put out into the world is worthwhile and within my reach. To give my clients my ever-evolving best, I'm going to apply to myself what I hope every person knows when they leave my chair: who you are and what you do matters and is worth believing in. And then I'm gonna ask you to care about and believe in me and this work. Opportunity has knocked and I am (cautiously and humbly (graciously?)) ready to answer.

In return, I am able to offer my gratitude, some laughs, some of my art, consultation on your hair journey, realistic and sustainable living space/clutter management, my skills as a chanteuse, one of a kind hair extensions and transformations using my shiny new skills. Check out the perks section! I hope you like mythological creatures and puns.

 

So, here's what I need:

- My goal is $1,700 CAD

- The course itself is $400 USD ($498 CAD)

- The flight & bus travel (depending on how soon I can book it) from Ontario to Washington state will be $500-700 CAD. 

- The platform costs should run about $120 CAD

- The rest of the amount will cover accommodations, food costs, lost work days, and unforeseen hiccups because why not reach for the stars and be prepared! This campaign is flex-funded so whatever I am able to raise will be put to good use!

I'll also need your confidence in me and your excitement to infuse the world with some more good-healing, transformative, colour magic. 

 

 Oh, and your hair to play with when I return from Rainbow School!

story:
Madhiri Mallik, five years old, is working 12 hours a day at brick factory in Hyderabad, India, BBC recently revealed. She has a problem with her eyes because of the smoke from the brick kilns, and she is sick from the water. Not far away from her two children, four years old, break coal down by hitting the pieces against each other. Madhiri's future looks bleak, and the cycle of poverty unrelenting.

Our Dream

Basis is not just a project that is close to the hearts of a few, it is a vivid dream that must be realized.

The Basis mission is to support children and teens in realizing their potential, so that they can become powerful agents of change in their lives and in the lives of others.

These are children and youth who are without homes, who are victims of trafficking and domestic labour, who have been subjected to abuse, who are girls who need to be protected from early childhood marriage. 

Every eight minutes a child goes missing in India. Girls are particularly targeted.

Together we can do something. We can provide loving homes, a playful learning environment, education, and vocational training through Basis.


What We Need & What You Get


Thomas Saverimuthu, Founder & Executive Director, congratulates a winner at a recent fundraiser in Braunschweig, Germany

BasisIndia e.V. is an established charity in Germany. Now we wish to establish Basis as a charity in Canada. For this we need to raise $1500 to cover start up costs.

Once Basis is established as a charity in Canada, we can partner with our supporters in Canada to realize the Basis dream, and also issue charitable tax receipts for your donations.

If this initial goal of $1500 is not reached, your donation will be refunded in full.

If we surpass this initial fundraising goal of $1500, the funds will be applied towards the building of a water tank and the renovation of the existing farmhouse on the site. Basis will run an office from here throughout the development and build of facilities. Also a number of village children will come here for tutoring and for a meal.

Your support will provide love, encouragement, education, and training to groups ages 4-18, and will help children and teens become confident and capable adults.

Basis is a small, grass roots initiative. We hope you will join us!


The current farmhouse on the building site in India

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute at this time, we completely understand. But please make some noise about our campaign! Share it with your friends and families! 

THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF OUR HEARTS.

Read more about Basis at www.basisindia.org

story:
The Brass Family’s Great Adventure

 

1.  Who We Are and What We’re Creating

A.   The Brass Family's Great Adventure: The Story.

The story of this online musical “book” is about the Brass Family: Papa Trombone, Mama French Horn, Toby Tuba and Cornetta Brass. They come to the Big City (New York?) at the turn of the last century. They manage to obtain a small tenement apartment; but they need money to survive. They each have their own tune, and go out and play in restaurants, on street corners, in the street market and in the subway; but they aren’t making enough to survive. Then they decide to do a melody where they all harmonize. This is louder and more beautiful than the individual tunes. They go to the Center of Town (5th Ave.?) and play it there. A famous bandleader hears them and hires them for his big band. And they are all very happy!  (18 pages of illustrated text).

 B.   Nancy L. Hoffmann: Writer, Illustrator, Designer and Educator.

Nancy has fifteen years of documentary and conceptual Illustration under her belt, along with five years as an ad agency copywriter and subsequent blogger and web content writer. Via her freelance company, TomatoDesign.Net, she has designed sites for a wide range of small businesses, utilizing her expertise as an ad agency art director and graphic designer, as well as web designer and developer. Additionally, she has a Master’s Degree in Elementary Education.

 C.    Clark Gayton: Brass Musician Extraordinaire.

Clark has had a long and exciting career playing every sort of music imaginable, and traveling to almost every country of the world. This summer he is playing with Bruce Springsteen’s E-Street Band’s World Tour. But he has also played and traveled with Sting (several times), The Mingus Big Band, The Skatelites, the Metropolitan Opera of NYC, Illinois Jacquet, and a great many other famous (and not so famous) musicians, as well.

He has expertise in both composing and arranging, and can be found playing various venues in New York City when he’s not on the road.

 D.   Russell Robinson, Computer Scientist and Veteran Programmer.

Russell is the owner of Tectite, and has enormous expertise in programming and online development. He will be a great asset to our team, as he is also a musician (woodwinds), and wants to see the cause of music education (much neglected in the USA!) advanced worldwide.

 

2.  Funding and Perks (for You)!

A.   YOUR PERKS As a Contributor (see column at right)!

  • Contribute $250 and your school gets free access for a year, in addition to your own FREE pass.
  • Contribute $95 and 30 children or teachers from your school will get access to the site, in addition to your own FREE pass.
  • Contribute $45 and your child's teacher will get access to the site to share with the class, in addition to your own FREE pass.
  • Everyone who contributes $20 or more to this project will receive a FREE pass to the site (normally, you would have to get a pass for a fee @ ±$25). It will be fun for both adults or children to make their own musical arrangements!
  • The story of the Brass Family coming to the Big City (apparently New York at the turn of the last century) is carefully researched to include the look and feel of what an immigrant would have seen and experienced in that time period. Extensive research informs the illustrations, but they are done in a whimsical style (as is the music), which would appeal to children. A teacher could project the site (or DVD) to a class, and could manipulate the music with the help of the children.

B.  Where the Funding Will Go

Russell will code this in HTML and JavaScript to make it very flexible and to work well on the iPad and other tablets.  As tablets don't have a mouse, one needs to design to adapt to a touchscreen. Snippets of audio, moving characters, etc. are all possible with these basic technologies.

Nancy would be researching, writing and illustrating in Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator: 18-20 pages.

Clark would be composing, arranging and digitizing the music for the site. This would require an investment in both equipment and hours.

C.   Our Track Record

Russell Robinson is the owner of www.tectite.com, and author of Tectite FormMail, an anti-spam PHP form processor with a long history.: see http://digg.com/newsbar/topnews/tectite_formmail_forms_processing for free form scripts. You can follow him at https://twitter.com/#!/tectitecom and get even more great information! Lastly, his LinkedIn page is http://www.linkedin.com/pub/russell-robinson/15/606/b9.

Nancy L. Hoffmann has successfully created many web sites over the years (see her site, http://tomatodesign.net for some examples), in addition to her extensive advertising and illustration careers. Her blog is http://tomatogreening.com and her Facebook page is http://www.facebook.com/nancy.hoffmann.

Clark Gayton has free music, tour dates, videos and photos at http://www.myspace.com/clarkgayton. You can also read his biography at Wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clark_Gayton. His Facebook pages is http://www.facebook.com/pages/Clark-Gayton/30836069726; and there is more about him at http://www.vervemusicgroup.com/clarkgayton. Sting calls him a consummate musician and says that Clark is part of his “musical family.” Need we say more?

D.   What If We Don’t Reach Our Entire Goal?
If we don’t reach our entire goal of US$55,000 by July 29, we will apply the money we have to the project and see how far we can get with it. Then we will try to raise funds again.

 

3. Why This Project Matters!

***  We are dedicated that Music and Art Education are essential to the development of every child, and we want to engage as many children as possible in the creative process.  ***

Children who are deprived of music education "may never be able to meet complex challenges because their talents are undeveloped . . . If a child is dancing, drumming and singing they simply cannot fail." — Jean Houston, Author, Teacher and Protegée of Margaret Mead.

 

4. Other Ways You Can Help

A.  Please Get the Word Out!

We need all the tweets, FaceBook  and blog stories, Hi5’s and anything else we can get to get he word out about our endeavor. If you know any educators or people with school-age children, tell them how this will help their district and classrooms bring music and art back to their kids. They will also be able to buy the “book” online for home use.

 B.   Please Don’t Forget to Use the Indiegogo Share Tools to Get the Word Out! 

 

***  Many Thanks from the Brass Family Team!!  ***
