http://www.worldbank.org/en/country/rwanda

story:
What is Ringette?

Ringette is a Canadian game that was first introduced in 1963 in North Bay, Ontario. Developed originally for girls, Ringette is a fast paced team sport on ice in which players use a straight stick to pass, carry, and shoot a rubber ring to score goals.

For ten years play centered in Ontario and Quebec, however the sport quickly spread across Canada and is now played in all ten provinces and the Northwest Territories.

In fact, the sport has become one of Canada's favorite activities for females, with over 50,000 participants, including players, coaches, officials and volunteers, across Canada - a remarkable growth rate for such a young sport.

More than 7,000 certified ringette coaches are registered in the National Coaching Certification Program, and 1,724 registered referees trained under Ringette Canada's National Officiating Program. In addition, there are thousands of volunteers who administer clubs, leagues, and tournaments across Canada.

HOW WE PLAY

We play with a ring and a straight stick

The ring is hollow and made of rubber. Sticks are not recycled hockey sticks. Companies produce sticks with tapered ends with steel, aluminum or plastic tips. Different styles, flex and weight are available.

We pass the ring at every blue line

A player cannot carry the ring over a blue line in either direction. The ring must be passed over the blue line to another teammate. The teammate is permitted to skate ahead of the ring carrier and already be across the blue line before the ring crosses it.

We never enter the goalkeeper's crease

If the ring lands in or on the crease, the only player who can touch it is the goalkeeper. The goalkeeper usually picks up the ring and throws to the teammate. The goalie has five seconds to pass it out of her crease.

We have 30 seconds to take a shot on net

Teams have 30 seconds to take a shot on goal after they gain possession of the ring. If time runs out a buzzer sounds and the other team is awarded the ring.

We play 3 on 3 in the offensive zones

You will notice the free play lines (small red line at the top of the circles) on the ice. From this line to the end boards, it's a game of 3 on 3. Players can rotate in and out of the free play zones producing a lot of movement and creativity.

We wear protective equipment

Players wear a neck guard, elbow, knee, and shin pads and equipment that provides hip and tailbone protection. Helmets with full face mask are mandatory. The masks must have triangular or tight horizontal bars to prevent the stick from penetrating.

We don't body check

Ringette promotes a no-contact policy when it comes to the physical aspect of its game. Penalties are given when a player makes excessive body contact with another player, checks a player too high on the stick, trips, hits or interferes with another player.

How did Ringette Get to Ann Arbor, Michigan?

During the 2011-2012 hockey season in Ann Arbor, some of the hockey coaches would run a drill in which players flipped their sticks upside down and had to keep control of a ring. Although this was definitely not Ringette, the players were told they were playing a version of the game. One of the players really enjoyed this particular drill and wanted to know more about it. After looking it up online, she asked her dad if she could play Ringette the following year instead of hockey. Her dad quickly found that not only were there no Ringette clubs in Michigan, there were currently none in the United States. After contacting Ringette Canada to get more information (the governing body for the sport) he agreed to start a club so his daughter could play.

In February 2012, Ann Arbor Ringette held their first Come Try Ringette FREE event and 34 kids showed up to try it. The first season was spring of 2012. A U14/U16/U19 team was fielded for the 2012-2013 season. To date the team has 13 players that have played 6 games against Canadian Ringette teams. We are actively recruiting and hope to have more kids next season.

Help Ann Arbor Ringette Start a Learn To Skate - Learn To Play Ringette Program!

Ann Arbor Ringette has worked tirelessly to grow the sport of Ringette in Michigan. We feel we have done well so far but would really like to grow the game for kids between the ages of 5 and 8. Doing this will instill a love for Ringette in the participants. This love for the game will stick with them as they get older which will allow us to offer more programs as they age (U9, U10, U12, U14, U16, and U19).

To grow the game, we would like to offer a Learn to Skate - Learn to Play program for kids ages 5 to 8.

What We Need To Make It Happen

To attract interest and players, we need to make the Learn to Skate - Learn to Play program very inexpensive. This is where you come in. We would like to offer a 5 to 6 month program during the 2013-2014 season in which players skate and play once per week. This program would be for kids ages 5 to 8. Ice time is expensive. On top of that, players need practice jerseys and equipment. Ice sports are typically unattainable for many children due to the price. We would like to change that and need your help to do it.
 
We would like to offer this program for no more than $120. This would include ice time and jerseys. In order for us to make this happen at that price, we need lots of funding. If we don't meet our goal, the money raised will still be used by our Ringette club either to buy more loaner equipment, subsidize ice time or to give scholarships to needy players.

How You Can Impact Our Community and Sport

Reaching our goal will allow us to offer a Learn to Skate - Learn to Play Ringette program for kids ages 5 to 8 in Ann Arbor, Michigan during the 2013-2014 season with minimal to no financial risk. This gets lots of kids out on the ice that may not be able to afford it otherwise. It also helps to grow the amazing sport of Ringette here in Michigan (and the United States).
 
If nothing else, you're helping to put smiles on the faces of up to 60 kids for 5 to 6 months.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not able to contribute? You can still help us by getting the word out and/or starting up a Ringette club in your area. Share our story, share this campaign! Help us reach our goal! We really believe that Ringette is an amazing sport and want it to grow. Please help us make that happen.
You can also "Like" us on Facebook to help spread the word: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Ann-Arbor-Ringette/252681781457730

story:
Ben Bisogno Colorguard Captain

Ben Bisogno, age 17, is a very talented colorguard flag spinner and leader of the Brewster High School Marching Band Colorguard. He was chosen to perform with the All American Marching Band in The Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade.

His passion for the sport has made his performances outstanding with advanced skills. He is also the only boy in the 20 member colorguard. He has helped the colorguard excel and helped bring the attention of the band to the Mayor of Dublin, who has invited the band to perform in the St. Patricks Day Parade in Dublin, Ireland.

Ben has raised some funds but needs an additional $800 to cover travel to Ireland.

Thank you for your generous contributions.

Ben Bisogno's family.

story:
Our Story

After visiting a women's cooperative in Rwanda, Colleen, Anna, and I were inspired to form Handmade Peace to help the women that we met and others bring their beautiful handmade products to consumers in the United States.

We are all graduate students in the various areas of peacebuilding, human rights, anthropology, and international law and we all share the common goal of using our careers to make fundamental human rights a reality for people all over the world. Anna Rushton, our co-founder and budding visual anthropologist, recently had her very first documentary ever picked up by PBS!! Encouraged by this recognition, she will be filming  our work throughout the year. 

The Idea

Handmade Peace is a peacebuilding through economic stability initiative.  Our ultimate goal is to contribute to sustainable peace and a world free from mass atrocity - an objective very dear to the Rwandans that we have met in light of the 1994 genocide that Rwanda endured.

We believe that poverty is a major contributor to conflict.  Structural marginalization and systemic social and economic injustice breeds unrest and disaffected populations. When we as humans are unable to care for our families we tend to look for a scapegoat to blame. This angst exacerbates racial, religious, ethnic and political tensions. Poverty is a real threat to on-going peace worldwide. 

Therefore, in an effort to promote economic stability among some of the most vulnerable, we are establishing Handmade Peace. Not only will we promote and distribute the products of the women's cooperative to consumers in the U.S. (who we are sure will love them!) via e-commerce, but also support the women in a series of business strengthening initiatives to help grow their successful model. As with any rooted systematic change, we believe the fiercest changemakers come from within the community (not imported "experts".) By partnering and supporting local leaders who can serve as mentors, employers and an inspiration for others in their community the ownership of action is grassroots based. Instead of creating another cycle of dependency we strive to invest in and encourage homemade economic security. We are starting our work selling the products of this particular cooperative, that inspired Handmade Peace, but we intend to expand to include the handmade products of vulnerable groups in other post-conflict countries in our efforts.

The Campaign

Colleen Creegan, Co-founder and Executive Director, was honored to be named as one of this year’s global Dalai Lama Fellows for this project. As part of that fellowship, which encourages compassion in action, she was able to secure us seed money that will enable us to pay for our initial year of programming and buy a small amount of inventory. Despite this ringing endorsement and show of support, there are still many other costs associated with starting an organization from scratch and running it smoothly, which is why we need your help!

Start-up costs include:

  • Incorporation and registration fees.
  • Maintaing the website
  • Marketing/Advertising
  • Branding (we will hand make our own tags so that the items purchased can be indentified HMP and in support of peacebuilding.)  
  • Shipping and transport
  • MORE INVENTORY! We are lucky enough to have many retailers interested in carrying our products. We want to ensure that we ship enough inventory to fill those orders and have enough left over to sell directly to consumers via our website)
  • Promotion/Networking: Just recently Colleen was invited to present HMP at the 2012 Poverty Action Conference in Virginia this fall. We will to travel to this and other development conferences/trade shows/business competitions to promote our model and engage with investors and grant makers. (None of us will make a salary or be compensated from the money raised here, but travel and accommodations will be incorporated into our yearly budget)

 

Any additional money raised could be used for a number of things:

  • Supporting the filmmaking
  • Continued technical and IT support for the cooperative
  • Even more inventory (in the end the more money that goes to the cooperative as earned income the more successful we will be)

 

Looking for other ways to get involved?

If you are unable contribute to our campaign at this time, but would like to support Handmade Peace, please spread the word about our organization among your networks. The more you talk about us, the less we have to spend of advertising :-) Shout it out, whisper it, gossip about us, tweet, blog, do an interpretative dance or send smoke signals out. We have a FB Fan Page, you can join the email list. In addition, please consider using the Indiegogo share tools to help promote our campaign!

A huge thank you for taking the time to read about us and getting to know our inspiration and motivation. At the end of the day it’s about participating in a global citizenship and standing up for peace by the power of your purchases. We are gratefully indebted to you for your love, time and financial support!

 

Please watch our video and consider joining our team by making a contribution, no matter how big or small! Remember to take advantage of the incredible perks!

story:
Me:

My name is Ema Eden, I am 27. I have been a Christian since I was 18. I have a BA hons in Events management, and I am currently working in Business Development Management. I have been part of 2 churches one in Bournemouth and one in Portsmouth. I have been a youth leader, small group leader and part of a team who work with Street working women. 

What:

I am asking for support to help me attend Iris Harvest School of ministry. It’s a 2 ½ month trip, which starts June 2014. I want to go this school and be part of this project mainly because of the founders. Heidi Baker has an amazing heart, Iris has a heavy focus on orphans, the poor and people who could count as social outcasts. One of her key phrases is “love looks like something.” This has really shaped me, its what I want my life to be about. I look forward to learning more about people who lay their lives down for people to show the love of God. Click here for a clip of Heidi talking about how love looks like something:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fam2vZDka90

Your contributions, any amount would be a serious blessing and I would be so grateful if in any way you can help. 

What I am asking for:

I am mostly trying to raise money for help with flights and tuition fees:

· Flights £1,100 (approx.)

· Fees: $3,000 (£1,800 approx.)

My other costs include: Insurance, medicine, vaccinations, extended outreach, malaria tablets, equipment (tent, water purification system)

All money donated will contribute to my trip, if I get over what I need for my costs. I will use the money for donations for practical needs for the Pemba base Iris ministries (such as food, clothes, toy donations for the children’s village)

If you are unable to donate – I still need your help

With the way indiegogo works, you can still help. Can you please use their tools of sharing and liking my campaign. The more that’s done the more people will see my campaign and hopefully the more likely it is I can reach my target. So if you can share on facebook, twitter, instagram and any other media form you are happy to I would really appreciate it. This campaign is only on for a month so I will not be plaguing after that!!! Many thanks for your time. Be blessed.

Links:

Iris Ministries:

Statement of Faith - http://www.irisglobal.org/about/statement-of-faith

Core Values - http://www.irisglobal.org/about/core-values

Harvest School:

Full course details - http://www.irisglobal.org/missions/harvest/about

Heidi Baker:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9BEiUsasdXQ

If you have any further questions, please feel free to contact me: ema.eden@talk21.com

Heidi Baker has an amazing heart, Iris has a heavy focus on orphans, the poor and people who could count as social outcasts. One of her key phrases is “love looks like something.” This has really shaped me, its what I want my life to be about. I look forward to learning more about people who lay their lives down for people to show the love of God. Click here for a clip of Heidi talking about how love looks like something:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fam2vZDka90Your contributions, any amount would be a serious blessing and I would be so grateful if in any way you can help. What I am asking for:I am mostly trying to raise money for help with flights and tuition fees:· Flights £1,100 (approx.)· Fees: $3,000 (£1,800 approx.)My other costs include: Insurance, medicine, vaccinations, extended outreach, malaria tablets, equipment (tent, water purification system)All money donated will contribute to my trip, if I get over what I need for my costs. I will use the money for donations for practical needs for the Pemba base Iris ministries (such as food, clothes, toy donations for the children’s village)If you are unable to donate – I still need your helpWith the way indiegogo works, you can still help. Can you please use their tools of sharing and liking my campaign. The more that’s done the more people will see my campaign and hopefully the more likely it is I can reach my target. So if you can share on facebook, twitter, instagram and any other media form you are happy to I would really appreciate it. This campaign is only on for a month so I will not be plaguing after that!!! Many thanks for your time. Be blessed.Links:Iris Ministries:Statement of Faith - http://www.irisglobal.org/about/statement-of-faithCore Values - http://www.irisglobal.org/about/core-valuesHarvest School:Full course details - http://www.irisglobal.org/missions/harvest/aboutHeidi Baker:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9BEiUsasdXQIf you have any further questions, please feel free to contact me: ema.eden@talk21.com

story:
Introduction to the Campaign

We seek your funding support to help us start the Emerging & Frontier Markets Association which will help  companies start  up or expand their businesses in the fastest growing  markets in Africa, Asia Pacific and Latin America.  The Association will focus on providing tax, legal and financial information to help executives and professionals gain the insight they need to operate successfully in these emerging markets.

These markets increasingly are  becoming important for global economic activity. Emerging markets have been identified by recent fast economic growth. Examples are the BRIC nations (Brazil, Russia, India, and China), Mexico, and many of the Asian nations. Frontier Markets refers to countries poised to be the next group of developing nations to see an economic boom. Examples may be Colombia, Peru, Indonesia, Vietnam, Turkey, South Africa, Ghana, Morocco and selected other countries in Africa.

Many commentators expect that before long these markets could represent 46% of global GDP. [i] Yet despite this great wave of expansion, for executives coping with the details of such investment including taxes, structuring foreign investments, M&A and  joint venture strategies, consumer and employment rules, and environmental regulations, authoritative information is often very limited, particularly in the attractive markets of Africa.

The Association will fill an important information need by giving small, medium and large companies the information they need to operate in  parts of the world with tremendous growth potential and limited information concerning tax, law and finance. This will encourage foreign direct investment in emerging and frontier markets and will result in increased employment, knowledge transfer, and improved standard of livings. The information will go well beyond the business opportunity or stock market context of many information services into the “nuts and bolts” type of information that cannot be found in any other place.

The Association will provide virtual and live educational seminars, round table events, and hubs of information to give companies the “how-to” intelligence they need to operate in a part of the world with tremendous growth potential and limited information. The first programs will emphasize tax and law issues in some of the attractive markets in Africa. A big four accounting firm in New York, and a law firm in Boston are willing to provide space and speakers for an initial program on legal aspects of doing the deal in Africa. Later programs and hubs will cover Asia and Latin America.

The organizers of EFMA are two individuals, Gary Brown and Robert Ross, with long experience in creating information services and programs to help multinational corporate executives overcome barriers in international emerging markets. Gary Brown was founder and CEO for over 25 years of a company which created and managed services covering some of the fastest growing countries in Asia and Latin America and the most difficult areas to obtain quality legal and financial information. For 25 years Robert Ross was founder and CEO of two continuing professional education companies which focused on international tax, finance and law. Gary sold his business to Thomson Reuters, which was looking to expand its tax and legal offerings, and Robert Ross sold his business to Bloomberg BNA, another major international law and tax publisher.

What is needed

This campaign is looking to raise $50,000. The purpose will be to design the web site, to promote the first program and memberships, and to compensate authors for authoritative, distinctive content. The first programs will emphasize tax and law issues in some of the attractive markets in Africa. 

It is anticipated that the Association will become self funding by having major law, accounting, consulting and banking firms become either individual or corporate members. Membership will entitle individuals to attend round tables and to receive electronic reports.

If the full $50,000 is not raised promotion of the first program and memberships will be more difficult, but any funds received will be spent for organizational and promotional purposes.

The following is a sample web page from the Tax, Law, Finance Africa Hub.The Association will feature Hubs of many important markets.


The Importance of the Association: More Details

Foreign direct investment (FDI) has surged into developing and frontier nations over the last decade. Global corporations invested more in emerging markets than the core economies of U.S., Europe and Japan, according to the United Nations Conference on Trade & Development (UNCTAD) World Investment Report published in mid-2013.  Such inflows provide capital to boost the recipients’ development. This is especially important for countries with low savings rates. FDI creates jobs in the recipient country and brings technical know-how and managerial expertise that can improve competitiveness. China’s success in achieving FDI-fuelled economic expansion over three decades demonstrates the allure of these flows.

Unfortunately, for executives coping with the details of such investments, authoritative information on the operation of local tax, law, regulatory and financial requirements is critical to the success of the venture but hard to access. It is very expensive to hire firms with answers or to know the questions to ask..

To help solve these issues, the Association will provide a place to go when an executive needs to compare what he/she knows with someone else. Through networking events, round tables and social media there will be a place to ask questions of other members who have been in the trenches of a particular emerging or frontier market. It will be a place where peers may discuss experiences and solutions.

In addition, the experienced executives organizing the Association will be able to bring in the right people to help continuously update the information hubs and electronic briefings which will be a key part of the Association.

Hubs will be created for specific regions. For example, a Hub focused on Africa is shown, entitled Tax, Law, Finance Africa.  According to a recent McKinsey & Company report, the rate of return on foreign investment is higher in Africa than in any other developing region. Although there are many differences and serious challenges in Africa’s 50 plus individual economies, (only the most promising would be covered in the Hub) the continent’s collective GDP at $1.6 trillion in 2008, is now roughly equal to Brazil’s or Russia’s, and according to McKinsey “the continent is among the word’s most rapidly growing economic regions.” [ii]

Reflecting the increase business activity in Africa, growth has caused many major law, accounting, consulting firms, and investment banking firms to stake out practices in the key industries under development in Africa including:

·  Oil & gas

·  Mining

·  Power

·  Transportation and Infrastructure

·  Telecommunications

·  Consumer goods

  • Private equity and finance

These firms provide occasional and irregular reports on some of their practice areas, but there is a need for more regular reporting and a site which organizes as much information as possible.

Successful Track Record

As mentioned above, the organizers have long experience in creating information services and programs to support attorneys, accountants and senior corporate executives who are making decisions on the proper structure for multinational businesses.

With the backing of lawyers at Hale & Dorr (now Wilmer Hale) and Kramer Levin and a business executive investor, Gary founded WorldTrade Executive (WTE) in 1991, which came to publish 20 information services and journals in international law and finance along with related books and reports. Representative titles published by Gary include a series on Practical International Tax Strategies with regional editions for Asia, China, Latin America, and the US; Latin American Law & Business Report; Venture Equity Latin America; Practical International Corporate Finance Strategies; Russian Petroleum Investor, and other titles.

Gary sold these services to Thomson Reuters in 2009 as TR sought to expand its international tax and legal offerings, and Gary continued to manage the publications until December 2013.

Gary also created conferences and webinars on topics covered by the various publications over the years, including one in partnership with Dow Jones and another in partnership with Chase Bank. Prior to creating WorldTrade Executive, Gary created Middle East Executive Reports and East Asian Executive Reports, covering law and business issues in these parts of the world.

Gary earned a J.D. from Georgetown University Law School.

For 25 years Robert Ross was founder and CEO of two continuing professional education companies which focused on international tax, finance and law. One entity was organized as a non-profit association, The Council for International Tax Education (CITE) and the other had a corporate for- profit structure, Atlas Information Group. In 2009 the two enterprises were sold to Bloomberg BNA, and Robert served as a consultant to Bloomberg BNA for three additional years.

Prior to creating CITE and Atlas, Robert served for three years as First Vice President and New York representative of Vereins and West Bank , a Hamburg based trade finance and commercial bank with strong activities in Latin America via its Miami office. He also spent four years as a Vice President with American Express Bank in New York and Brussels and with a British bank, UDT in London where he focused on sales finance, trade finance and M&A activities. Robert has an MBA from NYU, Stern School of Business.

Important Impact Not Diminished by Recent Capital Markets News

The Association will fill an important information need by giving small, medium and large companies the information they need to operate in a part of the world with tremendous growth potential and limited information concerning tax, law and finance..

The annual figures from the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development  (UNCTAD) as reported in the Wall Street Journal’s Real Time Economics Blog, show that emerging and frontier markets are taking an ever bigger part of the pie of foreign investment even despite global financial turmoil,. UNCTAD reported  at the end of January 2014 that inflows of foreign direct investment around the world climbed 11% in 2013 to about $1.46 trillion, from $1.32 trillion.  In 2012 the U.S. and other developed nations saw their share of total FDI inflows little changed from the 39% of 2012. Growth has been primarily in emerging and frontier markets.

In past days, capital markets and currencies in nations including India, Turkey, Argentina and South Africa have been hammered by a sell off. However, such abrupt shifts in “portfolio” investing shouldn’t be confused with the long-term trends in foreign direct investment flows, said Matthew Slaughter, a professor at Dartmouth’s Tuck School of Business, quoted in the WSJ blog. [iii]He pointed out that “oftentimes, the impetus of FDI flows can be quite different from the portfolio flows.”

Unlike the market snapshot, the UNCTAD data are “a low-frequency, long-term signal of where the world’s most productive companies are seeing business opportunities,” Mr. Slaughter said. The latest report offers “information about where these companies are placing their strategic bets,”[iv] and the information indicates very strong foreign investment in emerging and frontier markets.

The Association will start with African countries with the most attractive growth potential and will add other markets in Asia and Latin America. Users will gain information and the ability to network with other like-minded executives to navigate the minefields and complexities of operating successful enterprises in parts of the world that will have tremendous growth but in which information is quite difficult to access.

We Need Your Support

You the crowd funding support person will make it possible to develop this Association with its important networking and information exchange capabilities. You will benefit from the various premiums we have structured for you, such as the ability to access a Hub or to participate in various networking events


Footnotes

[i] http://www.goldmansachs.com/our-thinking/focus-on/growth-markets/index.html?cid=PS_01_25_07_99_01_08_01_CTA2

[ii] “What’s driving Africa’s Growth,” McKenzie Global Institute, June 2010.

[iii] http://blogs.wsj.com/economics/2014/01/30/foreign-investment-in-emerging-markets-stong-before-turmoil/

[iv] Ibid

story:
What are we doing to the Battleship Texas?

Having just celebrated her 100th birthday on 3/12/14, the Battleship Texas is prepared to embark on her mission for the next century: share the story of the only remaining dreadnought to have served in both World Wars, and bring the stories of all the brave sailors who served aboard her to life.

We will make the Battleship Texas, now a floating museum, into an interactive and immersive experience for visitors of all ages. As many as 12 digital multimedia vignettes and kiosks, as well as other interactive features, will be developed and installed throughout the ship. All of the enhancements will have a minimal impact on the ship itself, preserving and highlighting the beauty and history of good ol' BB35.

Be a part of history...and own a piece of it!

We're working with some great folks, and are going to bring Battleship Texas to the cutting edge of naval museums, and become a model for historic ships across the country! Still, it won't come easy...or cheap...

  • We need to pay for technology, hardware, software, app development, video and multimedia content, and all the people who will make this happen!
  • We want to reward you with interactive experiences of your own! From commemorative DVD's to owning a literal piece of the ship to a private event on the deck of the ship, you'll be contributing to your OWN immersive experience!
  • The more we raise, the more of our 12 stations will be created. If we don't raise as much as we like, we'll create fewer stations, but will still be able to make the ship more interactive! The amount we're looking for here will pay for the first 3 stations.

Preserve & Share the Battleship!

Few sailors who served on the Texas' decks are still alive to share their stories, and few from younger generations are aware of the significance of her contributions in both war and peace times. Your contribution supports honoring the sailors' legacy and raising awareness of them and the ship:

  • You will both own a piece of, and become a part of, the history of this great ship
  • You will help carry the story of generations of Americans to younger generations
  • You will be contributing to an effort supported by, and ENTIRELY supporting, the Battleship Texas Foundation and the Texas Parks and Wildlife Department.

Thank you for ALL your help!

If you don't make a donation today, but still want to help...or even if you did, and want to do more...that's great!

  • The Battleship Texas State Historic Site can always use volunteers! Visit www.BattleshipTexas.org for more information.
  • Do you have photos or videos of the ship through the years? Do you have a family member who served aboard the ship and would like to share their story? Let us know, and they could become part of the new interactive stations!
  • Did you contribute? Awesome...thank you! Please let your friends and family and neighbors and complete strangers know, and share the link...and the love!

For the ship!

story:
We have raised $10,000 in seed funding 


Start with Why

The 2011 MIT100k YouPitch finalist was born out of frustration due to the inefficient communication channels used in the university of Buea (UB) and countless other Universities in Cameroon W. Africa. In 2012 you may ask why? Well this is because the students and faculty still rely solely on Notice Boards, In Class Announcements and Mouth to Mouth to communicate. 

 

So together with Horace, Nara, Quincy and Leslie, we worked hand in hand with some seasoned educators and students to design the usePULSE platform which enables students, administrators and professors to communicate in real-time using primarily their mobile phones via SMS, web and email, in addition the platform also puts in place the usage of inexpensive android powered tablet devices, that cost about $50 per device. These devices allow convenient and efficient access to the platform maximizing capabilities.


In the last quarter of 2011 we obtained the go ahead from the University of Buea (UB) to commence with the first pilot program.  UB has about 17,000 students yet the pilot program will start with an initial 1000 users. Our Project is set to begin March 2012. 


You can also check out our beta


Here is what we will do during the pilot project

1. Empower the faculty through diverse training initiatives so that they can operate independently, assist students and find innovative new ways to use the platform.

2. Organize training sessions with the students and provide them with intuitive demos on how they can use the platform. The students will be able to immediately activate their usePULSE account through SMS.

3. The trained Faculty will invite the students to follow their course groups through an SMS. 

4. Film and document the entire experience and story of several students and lecturers from before the the pilot project to start of the project, till the end of the pilot project.  This footage will be used as feedback, analysis and also to create the documentary short which will be available as one of the perks to our contributors.
What about the Tablets 

These are low-cost tablet devices (android 2.2 devices have Wifi enabled, 2G of internal memory, SD slot, Mic, Stand by time: 10 hours (working time: 3-4 hours), and 7in Resistive touch screen), we will hold diverse training sessions for students and faculty on usage of the devices and platform and allow the students and faculty to use these devices free of charge.

 

You may have Tablets, but where is the Internet

Major campuses in Cameroon are covered by Wifi Hotspots. The University of Buea have a signed partnership with Ringo Sa to provide wireless Internet on the campus.


The PULSE Impact
Short Term: usePULSE is based of interactive education using ICT tools, this has the most profound lifelong impact on young entrepreneurial minds. it has been instrumental in influencing, encouraging and building hope amongst young Cameroonians.
Long Term: it will empower students allowing them to become independent learners who are well versed with ICT tools and therefore capable of unlimited achievement in their communities.  Long term goals are to scale to other universities in Cameroon and other African regions. 

 

Are you Guys really Serious

Yeah, we are more than serious, we have been featured on the Huffington Post, Myweku, Techloy and VC4Africa.


Why do you need our money

For the past 12months we made excellent progress on the platform, and currently have a working "beta" version ready but we have gone as much as our pockets can push us, we need this last push to finish and get the product into the hands of the students.

Our fund-raising goal is $15,000, when we reach our goal we will use the money for:

1. Accelerate the development and in addition to getting 100 devices which will be used by the participating students and faculty.

2. Acquiring a local sms shortcode and tons of bulk sms to cover us for at least a year. 

3. Organize training sessions for faculty and students. 

4. Prepare merchandise, ebook and the documentation about the usePULSE experience. So we are able to get our educational start up to reach students, universities, fans and supporters currently and in the future. 

5. Fees for the filming, and editing the footage for our documentary short. (re-imagine education will be edited by Cameroonian Director, William Nsai) 


If we raise more than our campaign goal, we will be able acquire more sms, devices and also increase the number students in our pilot phase.  Which would be beyond amazing. 

If we do not reach our campaign goal we will still continue on with our project and adapt our Tablet and sms short-code, faculty and student training and minimum team expenditures to the raised fund amount.


Rewards

In return for your kind contribution to this Pulse project, we're offering a number of cool personalized rewards, including Pulse Tablets, t-shirts, thank you page mentions, beta testing, high-resolution portraits, an ebook and a Documentary short about the project experience.


The perks are cumulative, which means that when you donate enough for a bigger perk, you also receive all the smaller perks below it. Hum !!! c'est pas lait.


Please add $10 for Shipping and Handling outside the U.S.


Others ways you can help

If you're inspired by the usePULSE project, please take a moment to share on Twitter, Facebook, Google+, Blog or whatever social media you use to spread ideas your excited about and you can also twitter (follow) and or facebook (like click) :)  and by all means fell free to say hello.  We love hearing from our supporters from around the globe.  We are driven and appreciate positive support. Thank you.

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
story_txt:
We have raised $10,000 in seed funding 




Start with Why
The 2011 MIT100k YouPitch finalist was born out of frustration due to the inefficient communication channels used in the university of Buea (UB) and countless other Universities in Cameroon W. Africa. In 2012 you may ask why? Well this is because the students and faculty still rely solely on Notice Boards, In Class Announcements and Mouth to Mouth to communicate. 
 
So together with Horace, Nara, Quincy and Leslie, we worked hand in hand with some seasoned educators and students to design the usePULSE platform which enables students, administrators and professors to communicate in real-time using primarily their mobile phones via SMS, web and email, in addition the platform also puts in place the usage of inexpensive android powered tablet devices, that cost about $50 per device. These devices allow convenient and efficient access to the platform maximizing capabilities.

In the last quarter of 2011 we obtained the go ahead from the University of Buea (UB) to commence with the first pilot program.  UB has about 17,000 students yet the pilot program will start with an initial 1000 users. Our Project is set to begin March 2012. 

You can also check out our beta

Here is what we will do during the pilot project
1. Empower the faculty through diverse training initiatives so that they can operate independently, assist students and find innovative new ways to use the platform. 
2. Organize training sessions with the students and provide them with intuitive demos on how they can use the platform. The students will be able to immediately activate their usePULSE account through SMS. 
3. The trained Faculty will invite the students to follow their course groups through an SMS.  
4. Film and document the entire experience and story of several students and lecturers from before the the pilot project to start of the project, till the end of the pilot project.  This footage will be used as feedback, analysis and also to create the documentary short which will be available as one of the perks to our contributors.








What about the Tablets 

These are low-cost tablet devices (android 2.2 devices have Wifi enabled, 2G of internal memory, SD slot, Mic, Stand by time: 10 hours (working time: 3-4 hours), and 7in Resistive touch screen), we will hold diverse training sessions for students and faculty on usage of the devices and platform and allow the students and faculty to use these devices free of charge.
 
You may have Tablets, but where is the Internet
Major campuses in Cameroon are covered by Wifi Hotspots. The University of Buea have a signed partnership with Ringo Sa to provide wireless Internet on the campus.

Our fund-raising goal is $15,000, when we reach our goal we will use the money for:
1. Accelerate the development and in addition to getting 100 devices which will be used by the participating students and faculty.
2. Acquiring a local sms shortcode and tons of bulk sms to cover us for at least a year. 
3. Organize training sessions for faculty and students. 
4. Prepare merchandise, ebook and the documentation about the usePULSE experience. So we are able to get our educational start up to reach students, universities, fans and supporters currently and in the future. 
5. Fees for the filming, and editing the footage for our documentary short. (re-imagine education will be edited by Cameroonian Director, William Nsai)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ryan Bart and I am a 23 year old magician native to Northwest Washington.  I am also an alumnus of the Fulbright Program, I hold a BA in Psychology from Gonzaga University and will be attending medical school in the fall of 2014.  Currently, I work with an inspiring non-profit called Magicians Without Borders. The mission of Magicians Without Borders (MWB) is to use the art of magic in order to entertain, educate, and empower the forgotten children of the world. 

Last year, during my Fulbright Scholarship year in Colombia, I developed a sustainable Magic Project in collaboration with MWB.  On February 23, 2014 I will travel to India on behalf of MWB, where I will teach the art of magic to daughters of sex workers from the brutal brothels of Mumbai.  I have seen firsthand how learning magic can transform the challenged life of a child growing up in the slums into one of limitless dreams and aspirations.

By supporting Magicians Without Borders in India, you will bring magic and hope to some of the world's most forgotten children.  We have been traveling to India for 3 years, but never for longer than 2 weeks at a time.  Our goal for my three months in India is to deepen our students' passion for learning magic while more fully integrating our program into the community of Mumbai magicians.  With the collaboration of Mumbai magicians, our magic students will be able to attend weekly magic classes rather than just a few classes a year.  This will make our program in India sustainable, just as it is in Bogota, Colombia where our students were recently recruited to perform at a holiday party for one of the country's most prominent banks. 




What We Need 

This campaign will supplement our total India budget and without these funds, this project will not be possible.  Magicians Without Borders is a registered 501(c)3 non-profit so 100% of your contribution is tax-deductible.  All of the funds raised from this campaign will go directly to improving our program in India. This campaign will contribute:

$1,000 for magic props that our students will keep

$750 for program logistics such as transporting our students to performances and taking them out of the city for a weekend magic camp

$750 towards my airfare of $1,250

If additional funds are received, they will go directly towards closing the gap on our total budget which is just under $5,000.  This is your opportunity to become a supporter of MWB and contribute to the sustainability of our work in India.  


The Impact

Your support will have a lasting effect.  We are at a turning point for our project in India and have decided to go all in.  Having boots on the ground for three months instead of two weeks will allow us to deepen our connection with our students and become more fully integrated into the community of magicians in Mumbai.  Our students in India have been performing semi-regularly and they will thrive at a whole new level with the increased frequency of classes and attention.  Once we have a strong core group of students, these very students will then pay it forward and teach what they have learned to new students.  

We realize that not all of our students will become seasoned magicians.  That is not our goal.  However, if they develop a desire to learn and an understanding that they are capable, then we have done our job.  We have a scholarship fund that supports our magic students to continue their formal education if they choose to do so.

Rosalba Martinez, the lead coordinator from Bella Flor in Colombia stated,  “Since these children have been studying magic they attend the program more regularly, coming two or three times a week to practice their magic. They are more responsible and punctual. They are becoming leaders with the other children.”



The success of the Colombia Project, which I developed and continue to direct can assure you that your contribution will be utilized in a meaningful manner. We cannot bring magic into the lives of forgotten children and families in the far corners of the world without you!   


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Our work requires more than financial support.  We are able to go out into the world and create magic because we are supported back home.  Please stay in touch, we could not do this without you.  And, please help us get the word out and keep the magic alive by sharing this campaign with your social networks.  Thank you!!

story:
Help me get my Master's Degree! 

Currently, I am the 4-H Program Assistant.  I am ready to take Principles of Entomology at the University of Florida!  Please help me pay for my class!

Here's the story: 

The class I am taking is offered as undergrad or Graduate level.  I am ready to take the undergrad level, as I have saved enough to do that.  I can upgrade to the graduate level if I can pay another $950.  my husband and I have worked hard to be debt free, and have followed the Dave Ramsey plan.  I hope to be able to take this class as a graduate level, but if not, I am still going to take it because it will help me with my degree!  If you would like to help me, anything will help.  If I don't reach this goal, I will use any money toward next semester.  I am already saving for the next $1700 I will need for the next class!  Thanks for your help! 

 

I only need $950, but with the fees, that is why my goal is higher.

story:
What is Xplicit Math ?
The idea behind XplicitMath.com is to have a free website that will explicitly show all the steps involved in mathematics calculations. Our educational philosophy is that there is no shame in breaking down math problems so that a novice can see all the basic the steps involved.

Why Xplicit Math ?
This is useful because many times teachers are unable to show all the steps due to time limitations. In a similar fashion, solution manuals can't show all the steps because of space limitations. Additionally, omitting those steps may sometimes leave the student guessing ,in the dark, about how to transition from one step to another. XplicitMath.com hopes to change that. Our endeavor to create a mathematics application that will fill in the gap and be able to show the steps between the steps. XplicitMath.com  will be the only free website that will show users step by step solutions for a wide variety of basic mathematics problems.

Current Functionality
Currently XplicitMath.com is able to show step by step calculations for some mathematics such as synthetic division, polynomial division and all of the vector mathematics operations. However, its still in its developmental phase and there's much more work to be done.

Future Functionality
The goal is that XplicitMath.com version 1.0 will be able to show a step by step solutions for :

  • solving equations
  • converting between units
  • simplifying expressions
  • factoring
  • foiling

It will also have :

  • an improved the user interface
  • mathematics tutorials


Why we need your support
Your support is greatly appreciated and will be used to pay for the following:

  • the maintenance of servers
  • graphic designers
  • beta testers
  • programmers


Thank you
Your support is greatly appreciated and thank you for making this idea into a reality.

story:
BACKGROUND


WHO WE ARE

We are Sports for Sharing, an innovative educational program that forms better citizens from childhood through carefully designed classroom and playground activities modeled on traditional games and sports. We work with elementary schools to promote the following values:

  • Fair play
  • Gender equality
  • Teamwork
  • Empathy
  • Responsibility
  • Respect
  • Tolerance 

Sports For Sharing in the United States benefits from strong ties to its parent organization, Deportes para Compartir, an internationally-acclaimed not-for-profit that began in Mexico and which today is recognized by the United Nations, and supported by major companies such as Ford and Starbucks, for successfully building  programs with schools in many countries.

Dina Buchbinder, a world-renowned social entrepreneur, founded Deportes para Compartir in Mexico back in 2007. She identified unprecedented ways to empower children as agents of change and in turn created a powerful program to engage children at an early age through the universal language of sports and games. In no time, schools implementing the program demonstrated reduced violence and bullying, with increased levels of physical activity, consumption of fruits and vegetables, and practice of civic values.

The success of the program in Mexico on a national scale paved the way to introduce Sports for Sharing in the United States, making it one of the few education programs expanding from South to North. For the past year, our team of staff and dedicated volunteers has been working hard to develop our curriculum, forge new partnerships and connect communities of change agents across borders.

The collaborative nature of the activities offered by the Sports for Sharing program has transformed relationships between teachers and children at the schools while strengthening the self-confidence of the students, and their understanding of teamwork, a powerful skill for their development as global citizens.


WHY THIS CAMPAIGN IS IMPORTANT TO US

You can be the first one to help us succeed in this new and exciting phase of expansion in the United States! Through this campaign we hope to raise enough funds to buy materials for our new partner schools and help create an atmosphere of safe and inclusive play inside and outside the classroom.

Sports for Sharing operates with a simple, straightforward methodology: it all starts with a teacher training, usually at the beginning of the school year, where teachers become familiar with our bilingual curriculum materials. Then the program is delivered for a full academic year in Spanish and English and focuses on raising awareness about the Millennium Development Goals of the United Nations through sports and games. We simultaneously have special sessions with parents, Athlete Ambassadors and our sister schools in Mexico, Guatemala and Argentina, with whom US students from different contexts will exchange handcrafted cultural treasures. 

This is where YOU fit in! Your donation will allow us to innovate and tailor the Sports for Sharing program not only in the 5 pioneer schools currently using it, but also to bring in at least one more school in Washington DC and expand the program to 2 new schools in Houston, Texas. That means you will be helping Sports for Sharing have a positive impact on the lives of over 2,000 children this year, contributing to the future success of the program.

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise $30,000 in this campaign: $22,500 will cover the cost of the materials needed (including balls, hula hoops, jumping ropes, frisbees, cones, Millennium Development cards, arts and crafts supplies, printed guides and more) for the participation of all 2,000 children in our US programs; $7,500 will be dedicated to training teachers, developing new and exciting games and translating our curriculum materials from Spanish to English for a fully bilingual experience. That averages to only $15 per child for an entire year of Sports for Sharing!

Additionally, we have created an exciting list of perks to thank you for your contribution. All the rewards are cumulative: you will receive everything offered below your donation target in addition to the item you selected. Check them out!


    The Impact

    How did Isaac Camacho, a 12-year-old boy who participated in Sports for Sharing in Mexico, end up appearing on TEDxYouthDF as an agent of positive change?  By creating three projects to reduce waste in his community, an initiative directly inspired by games in our program such as "Don't Spoil The Water".  

    The curriculum designed by our expert educators is a powerful learning tool that conveys knowledge about global issues and leverages play, the universal language of children. At the same time, because each of the Sports for Sharing activities emphasizes al least one of the eight United Nations Millennium Development Goals, children become fully aware of global challenges affecting people just like them around the world. Our games instill in them the value of participating in their community from an early age. 

    Sports for Sharing fits perfectly with school administration and teaching staff priorities to assure that children come away from their classroom experience understanding and living values of tolerance and community building. After a year of piloting in the US, we have already registered a substantial impact among children participating in the program: 


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please help raise more funds by sharing with people who identify with our cause. Like and share our Facebook page with you friends and family. Stay connected by subscribing to our Newsletter and following us on Twitter and Instagram. 

    Check our website to see other ways to get involved.

    Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Inspiring dancers around the world since 2003

Starting with its online dancer community hotspot, Boogiezone has touched lives and sparked the careers of countless dancers around the world. Now, we need the help of our community to make our physical hub Boogiezone Utopia in Torrance, California become the active vital center for dance and creative arts that can live up to our ever-growing arts education and community programming. 

We want to provide a center that can support everybody's aspirations to become the best artist they can be, whether they wish to be industry professionals, independent artists, or just love to dance! Your contributions will be the life of Boogiezone Utopia, helping us build and maintain our facility and personnel so that we can best serve YOU!

Building up Boogiezone Utopia

Our wonderful home has been housing dancer education since 2011, and it can use a bit (ok, a lot!) of sprucing up! We would love our hardworking students and faculty to be able to enjoy and thrive in our creative space. Here are where we most need our funds:

Exterior Facelift: We need a sign! What!? It's been two years and people in town still don't know where we are? Help us getting a big, flashy Boogiezone Utopia sign up there so that people know where this crazy, bumpin' place is! Material, permits, and construction combined, signage, new canopies, and vinyl banners will cost us approximately $15,000. 

Sound: What would a dance studio be without a beautiful sound system to go with it? Many of our studios could use a sound boost, and two of our rooms need better soundproof windows so our neighbors can rest easier at night. This enhancement could cost approximately $3000.

Plumbing: A basic but way too often overlooked need for running water! In all honesty, we need it. We just do. $6000 to replace pipes and fix things up.

Air: If you've been to our studios, you know that it gets HOT in here! $3000 will get us three units of air conditioning, some portable fans and extra ventilation. 

Maintenance and Support: It takes a lot more than just good facilities to keep our place going. Our largely volunteer-based staff needs some support now again, whether that be in maintenance supplies, repair costs, or a warm pat on the back. Approximately $8000 will be allocated to ongoing maintenance and programming support, including money needed to put on or sponsor shows, produce events, and workshops. 

Become a Boogiezone Utopia Honoree!

Your support matters the world to us, which is why we will mark your name down publicly in Boogiezone History if you can help us out. For our most dedicated donors, we offer you the sponsorship of one our precious studio spaces, which will be dedicated personally to you! See below for an idea of what a dedication might look like.  For the full list of perks and more information, see the listing on the right.

ROOM DEDICATION
Now you can officially say you own a piece of Boogiezone Utopia by sponsoring any one of our 7 studio rooms! How amazing is it to know that because of your contribution, love and passion for art and creativity is thriving!

WALL MURAL DEDICATION

Here is an idea of what the Wall Mural Dedication could possibly look like. With your help we can turn this space into something fantastic!

STAIR DEDICATION
Also, here is the concept and vision for the Stairwell Dedication.  Your support will get your personal name, company logo, or brand on a riser of our main staircase.  How awesome is that? 

The 1st Annual BZ Utopia Gala: July 30th, 2014

To celebrate our supporters and over a decade of dynamic community building and dancing, Boogiezone will be hosting its first annual Gala on July 30th, 2014 in house in our spacious Ballroom. Come join us for a black-tie affair and a night full of entertainment, food, and celebration! Tickets can be purchased for a minimum of $25 through this indiegogo campaign, or as a part of your greater donation. You won't want to miss out!

Can't contribute now but still want to be part of our fantastic community? No problem!

We welcome everyone and anyone who aspires to dance and to create! Even if you can't donate, there are still ways to support!

  • Come visit our studio at 1951 Carson St. Torrance, CA 90501 and take a dance class! For our class schedule visit www.boogiezoneutopia.com
  • Spread the word about our campaign and our upcoming programs (see www.boogiezoneutopia.com for more info)
  • Participate in Boogiezone's online dance community by visiting www.boogiezone.com!
  • Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, Youtube and Twitter @boogiezone and @bzutopia

Any Questions about this Campaign?

We'd love to hear from you, if you have any thoughts or ideas. Please email elmboogie@boogiezoneutopia.com with subject "Boogiezone Indiegogo"

story:
Shore Relief Promo Video

https://vimeo.com/53626054

 

Who we are...

      Shore Relief is a fund that has been set up in conjunction with Destiny Community Development Corporation (CDC) and New Beginnings Christian Church in Brick, NJ. Both organizations have been established and running community efforts in Ocean County for years. Destiny CDC, as well as New Beginnings Church, have a reputation of meeting the needs of  our community. Destiny CDC operates a food pantry in Brick, NJ and has been for over the past 6 years.
      After Hurricane Sandy devistated our shores here in Ocean County on October 29th, many have been left homeless. We want to help these families and keep them warm and fed.

What We Need

       Shore Relief is commited to bringing necessary items (food, clothing, blankets, socks, hygene products, water, etc.) to the people affected by this storm. Our current food pantry in Brick, NJ will be converted to a relief center to reach the families of Brick and northern Ocean County. We are commited to opening an addtional relief center in southern Ocean County to be able to reach more people. Our goal of $50,000.00 will go to open that relief center and stock both centers with the above necessities.

Your Impact

       Your donation is going to make all these things possible here on the Jersey Shore. Our area was hit very hard and most of the shore hot spots have been forever affected. If you would like to help make a difference in this area, please donate and help us bring relief to the Jersey Shore.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are able to help in other ways, consider donating the following items:

Blankets
Socks
Water
Clothes
Hygene Products

 

Click below to see how we have already begun to help the community.

http://www2.wsls.com/news/2012/nov/05/donations-southwest-virginia-are-hands-sandy-victi-ar-2339316/?referer=None&shorturl=http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2FTGJNgt

 

Thank you for helping us reach out to the hurting at the Jersey Shore.

story:
What is this? What are we doing?:

We are trying to reduce the unemployment rate in the US (for now, but we want to go global) through training in an industry that is very nearly recession proof.

Recession proof? Really?... Yes, really! The IT industry has seen growth throughout the economic recession starting in 2008, that's right it never stopped growing! During the State of the Union Obama shared the statistic of there being twice as many jobs in science and technology than there are qualified people!! We would like to fix that, but we need your help. Hit the donate button and help a small company Spread the Word that we are out there, available, and willing to help!

Can't afford to donate? Just browsing through but want to help?

This part is very easy, click the social networking buttons below. Just by doing this you are helping to Spread The Word and get the information out there that there are people who want to not just help, but guide you through the process step by step. You can fan us on Facebook, and follow us on Twitter, you can join Ridge on LinkedIn, and subscribe to our YouTube channel. Check out the YouTube channel after the campaign for some funny bloopers and goofs we ran into while filming the videos. 

The Impact

We have built this company around the idea that helping people meet and exceed their goals is our top priority. As we said in the video we are working with the V.A. to provide free training to current, transitioning, and retired military. We are working with state unemployment offices and other non-profits to provide reduced cost or free training for the unemployed. And if you can't qualify for one of these programs we have a "Nominate Your Neighbor" campaign designed to allow the "average Joe" to get the training they need to be successful.

We all know someone these days who is looking for work, and we can help make that person marketable. I could bore you with a bunch of statistics about how getting certified will help you get a job/raise/promotion but I think the proof is in the pudding. 

If we don't get the word out, which we need your help to do, the people who need this training most may never hear about the offers we have. The unemployment rate in this country is horrific, and we are offering people the opportunity to get the training they need (in many cases for free) so they can find a stable, permanent career.


Why should you donate?

Your donation will be used to fund our Spread The Word campaign. We are using the funds generated here to put articles in the Military Times so that our service members can learn about the training available to them after they have served. We will post advertisements in local papers across the country, and put ads up in airports. We will use some of the money to help fund some 5k's promoting training and aid for the unemployed. We will also set some of the money aside for helping someone you know (or don't know) get certified.

story:
Hello, my name is Melissa Wright. I am a student living in a small town in New Hampshire with my mom and younger brother. I am a photographer and graphic designer (or at least I try to be). I’m just your average 24 year old woman. You know, going to school, looking for a job, hanging out with friends, and being super geeky and proud of it. 

Unfortunately, I cannot always enjoy life the way I want to. I live in consistent pain and feel ashamed because of the condition of my teeth. You may notice that in any pictures I've included are of me smiling, showing no teeth. Below this paragraph are pictures of the condition of my teeth. They are in such poor condition that they hardly seem worth calling teeth at this point. I hide my mouth in social situations; I feel like people judge me based on its appearance and possibly even make fun of me for it. Worse than all of that though, is the pain. Usually the pain is dull or just achy, and on good days I can’t even feel it at all (although those are few and far between). Then there are the bad days, really bad days where the pain is so excruciating I end up visiting the emergency room in the middle of the night to get something for the pain. Then of course I am left with the cost of a hospital bill for that little bit of relief. Over the years I have learned to ignore the looks I get, adapted to eat pretty normally, and for the most part I can suffer silently through the pain. Recently though, I thought I had found the answer to my dental problems.

 

A local non-profit dental clinic in the area took me on as a patient as of today (11/12/2012), and I have had two teeth extracted, leaving a remainder of 21 to be taken out before I can get dentures. However, there was a miscommunication regarding pricing. I was originally told that each appointment would cost $52 or so, and it was phrased in such a way that I believed that it would be covering everything done at each appointment. Then I was told that the entire set of dentures would cost me around $936. The original plan, based on the estimate as I understood it, was to make a down payment, pay the remaining balance bit by bit each month and have it paid off by February.

My appointment today cost $329, and I need at least 11 more of the same appointments to have the rest of the teeth extracted. A full set of dentures will cost me $936 for the top and an additional $936 for the bottom.  My costs are no expected to be in the neighborhood of $5000-$6000. I do not, nor will I anytime soon, have the money to pay for such costs. I am a student, unemployed, and uninsured. This kind of money is just not readily available. I was devastated of course when I found all of this out. I’d hate to be so close to a solution and to living a normal, pain free life only to have to give up because of my financial situation.

With all that being said, I am determined to find a way to pay for it. Anything any contributors can give would be a huge help. Even if I receive enough to pay for the next appointment or even just to pay the remaining balance for today’s appointment, it would be immensely helpful. If enough money was raised to pay for everything in full, I would be overwhelmed. I would never feel like I could thank you enough, but I would certainly try. Either way my life would be changed by some amazing, generous people who are caring enough to donate money to someone they don’t even know. I know my thanks would never be enough, but I will try my hardest to make it worth your while with the following perks:

$5- A personal thank you email from me. I know it isn’t much, but I want to be able to thank each and every person who donates even a little bit.

 

$10- A personalized thank you card. As an aspiring graphic designer one of the things I can offer are my skills. In this case, I would be sending you a thank you card designed and personalized by me.

 

$25- A personalized thank you card and homemade candy. As a hobby I make candy and I would love to share that with contributors even if it may be a little ironic given what the cause is.

 

$50- A personalized thank you card, homemade candy, and a 12x8 matte photo print out of my portfolio. Since I’m putting all of my skills out there I figured I’d offer some of my photography experience. If you can donate $50 to my cause I will send you a link to my portfolio where you can choose which photo you would like as a print.

 

$100- A personalized thank you card, homemade candy, and a 12x18 matte photo print.

 

$150- A personalized thank you card, homemade candy and an 11x14 canvas print.

 

$200- A personalized Thank You card, homemade candy, and my design services. This includes things like logos, shirts, business packages (envelope, stationery, and business card), etc.

 

$250- A personalized thank you card and a gift basket including homemade candy, a small photo print, baked goods and other various goodies. It’s a gift basket after all you have to be a little surprised at least.

 

$500- A personalized thank you card, homemade candy, a photo print of your choosing in any size you would like and either my design services or a gift basket.

 

$1000- Everything! Literally everything I have listed here. The thank you card, the candy, the photo print, the gift basket, my design services,  my eternal thanks, and if there is something else I can think of that too!

 So, there it is. my story, what I would like to get out of this campaign, and what I want to give you in return. Remember anything you can give is greatly appreciated. If you can’t give financially I would be grateful to you if you could spread the word. Even if I don’t make my goal, any money at all will still help me make progress. Any progress I can make on this issue will lead to major improvements in my quality of life. Thank you so much in advance! I look forward to updating you all soon.
